Harvard UniversitySchool/Unit: Harvard Graduate School of EducationJob Function: Information TechnologyTime Status: Full-timeDepartment: CEPRSalary Grade: 058Union: 00 - Non Union, Exempt or TemporaryThe Center for Education Policy Research (CEPR) at Harvard University is a unique partnership among districts, states, foundations, and university-based researchers designed to leverage the overwhelming amount of newly available school-, teacher-, and student-level data to address previously intractable policy questions in education and improve educational outcomes for all students.CEPR is looking to hire a talented Data Manager to oversee our core data management functions. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to, and to help develop, one of the education sector's leading research centers. By managing CEPR's data infrastructure, the Data Manager will help support research that strives to improve the prospects of K-12 students in public school systems across the country.Duties & Responsibilities:The Data Manager will have overall responsibility for maintaining and directing the ongoing development of the data infrastructure that serves as the foundation for CEPR's research. The Data Manager will oversee CEPR's core data management functions, such as acquiring/transferring all research-related data; processing and preparing data to ensure that they are of the highest quality; ensuring compliance with all data security requirements and contractual agreements with CEPR's partner education agencies; serving as the primary liaison between CEPR, Harvard University IT (HUIT) and Harvard Graduate School of Education IT (HGSE IT); and coordinating the work of the various information technology specialists, consultants, contractors and CEPR staff that support the Center's data-related work.Additional responsibilities include developing and tracking data project timelines, preparing status reports and data reports for both internal and external use, managing data resources, and serving as the primary thought leader on the design of new data-related tools and processes that could enhance CEPR's research.Specific accountabilities include:Managing the extract, transform, load (ETL) data processes and the secure acquisition and transfer of research-related data; Enhancing current processes for the efficient, secure transfer of encrypted data.Developing data-related procedures and systems that comply with federal, state and local regulations governing personally identifiable information and protection of human subjects.Ensuring compliance with all data security requirements. Working with CEPR administrative staff to create processes for monitoring compliance with the Data Use Agreements.Overseeing the maintenance of CEPR's internal data infrastructure, including maintaining data access rights and developing processes for sound data preparation, analysis and storage (e.g., consistent file-naming conventions, program documentation, standards regarding programming best practices, archiving of data from completed projects, etc.). Collaborating with CEPR's research staff to ensure that the Center's data are of the highest quality.Collaborating with CEPR's Principal Investigators and research staff to produce “data specs” to guide research acquisition.Supervising and developing a small team of Data Analysts. Working with data and research staff to create a center-wide process for cleaning raw data and preparing it for research use (including performing various data quality and plausibility checks).Serving as lead liaison between CEPR, HUIT, and HGSE IT to ensure that CEPR is meeting the University's security and data requirements.Developing strategic plans regarding CEPR's IT and data resources to ensure that the Center is well positioned to perform its work as efficiently and effectively as possible moving forward.In collaboration with CEPR COO, developing and maintaining an ongoing costing model of CEPR's data and IT functions, providing a basis for quantification of the full-scope of servicesOverseeing server administration tasks and the maintenance of the data warehousing environment, including supervising staff, consultants, contractors, etc. who provide related services.This position has a 6 month Orientation and Review period.This position is grant funded for one year from the date of hire with the possibility of renewal.Basic Qualifications:BA or BS and a minimum of 3 years of experience managing large scale data projects for the purposes of supporting research or analysis. Demonstrated expertise with database management, ETL processes, and dealing with large volumes of data. Experience programming in one or several data management and statistical programming software packages (e.g., SQL, SAS, STATA, R).Additional Qualifications:Graduate degree in social science or information science. The more experience dealing with large volumes of data the better. The ideal candidate will be highly productive working under pressure with time constraints, possess the ability to work independently, with supervision, or in collaboration as a team. Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail. STATA programming experience; experience working with K-12 public education data, such as human resource, financial, student, and school data. Preference for candidates interested in state or local education policy research and experience working with K-12 public education student information systems (e.g., PowerSchool). Experience in a social science research setting a plus.Additional InformationPlease attach resume and cover letter as one document.We regret that the Harvard Graduate School of Education does not provide Visa sponsorship.About the Harvard Graduate School of EducationMany choose to work at the Harvard Graduate School of Education because they believe in our mission and are excited by our vision for the future. We have a reputation as a great place to work, for our excellent leadership, and we are a strong community that values diversity. For more information about HGSE, its programs, research, and faculty, please visit: www.gse.harvard.eduPre-Employment ScreeningIdentityEEO StatementWe are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Apply Here

this is a remote position; US/Canada onlyAbout BarkBark is software that helps keep children safe online from cyberbullying, sexting, and online predators. Using proprietary machine learning based software, Bark alerts parents and children to potentially dangerous activity, along with specific, relevant information and recommendations. At Stitch, the data science team works to drive internal business and product decisions with empirical evidence and experimentation. We are also strong believers that Stitch can bring a similar level of insight to our customers by helping them make decisions around their own purchasing, inventory, and sales processes. As Stitch grows as a company so has the scale of data there is a continual effort to make access to data, insights, and experimentation scaleable for both internal analysis and customer facing insights.We are looking for an experienced data scientist to join our team and expand upon the work we have done and help lead the quantitative direction of new projects.An exceptional candidate will thrive at the intersection of data analysis, project management, and business acumen. You will prioritize projects and methods, understanding the opportunity cost and business implications. You favor iteration over perfection, acknowledging that there is no perfect way, but there is always a better way.What You'll DoOur work has a tremendous impact on the business. If you have a proven background in this field and are excited to help build our rapidly growing team, we want to hear from you! On any given day, you might be:Collaborating cross-functionally with other business leaders to realize and execute on opportunitiesInnovating and building new data products that move key company metricsContributing to the technical vision around the tools we use and the way we workMaintaining and creating new algorithms to bring data and insights, such as demand forecasting to our customers at scaleBuilding a model and working with our engineering team to notify our customer team of customers who are at risk for churning or our sales team of customers who are primed to be upsoldDiving deep into our dataset to find fascinating (or informative) data insights and unexpected correlations that the press and retailers are excited by and interested in reportingMentoring less-experienced members of the team toward becoming better data scientists, and help the broader company increase their understanding and ability to analyze and interpret dataQualificationsProven technical background as a data scientist or a PhD in a quantitative fieldAbility to write clean and concise code, especially in R or PythonSolid understanding of statistics and data science methodsIntuition for data science best practices, stemming from proven experienceDeep domain knowledge in at least one business area and experience with large scale data setsExcellent communicator who inspires action through data storytelling, enhanced with strong, clear visualizations and communicating technical results to a nontechnical audienceIntense intellectual curiosity -- strong desire to always be learningAnalytical, creative and innovative approach to solving difficult problemsWhy Stitch?We are a restless bunch at Stitch. We're leaders in our industry, but our hunger to make an impact on the world is barely satisfied. Our grit, passion, and unyielding dedication to improve the lives our customers influences our culture in ways you won't find at other companies. And while we continue to be the best, it doesn't go without care, compassion and appreciation for the people around us. When you walk in our doors, you'll find smart, courageous people who consider one another family. And this is something we protect every day.You'll be encouraged to embrace curiosity and always ask "why". Whatever you thought about working hard will be put to the challenge here. So if you are the kind of person who welcomes the challenge, an environment that will push you to grow and a company that moves quickly, well - you've found the right place.How to ApplyRemember, we're looking for someone who can process and analyze data, as well as communicate it in order to impact the business. Your cover letter should make it immediately evident that you've taken the time to research Stitch's product and values. It should succinctly describe why you're the best fit for this position on our team. You're in-freaking-credible, sure, but why are you the amazing candidate that Stitch needs?We're looking forward to hearing from you!

At Stitch, the data science team works to drive internal business decisions and product decisions with empirical evidence and experimentation. We are also strong believers that Stitch can bring a similar level of insight to our customers by helping them make decisions around their own purchasing, inventory, and sales processes.We use our sharded MySQL application database as a source of information for analysis in Python on a daily basis. Providing customer facing insights, we use Sqoop and PIG to ingest data into HDFS and forecast at scale with Hadoop Streaming. As Stitch grows as a company, so has the scale of data; there is a continual effort to make access to application data scaleable for both internal analysis and customer facing insights. We're looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our data science team to own the infrastructure and ETL processes within our data stack. What You'll DoAn exceptional candidate will be a pioneer who thrive in a semi-unstructured and ambiguous environment. You’ll navigate resource constrained start-up culture with ease and resiliently respond well from collaboration to communication and from speed through iteration. So if you are the kind of person who welcomes the challenge, an environment that will push you to grow and a company that moves quickly, well - you've found the right place.About Stitch LabsStitch is an online inventory control solution that simplifies multichannel retail business. It automatically syncs inventory, orders and sales across channels, which provides retailers a holistic understanding of their operations. With Stitch, retailers save time, make better decisions, and grow their business. 15001652The Center for Information and Research on Civic Learning and Engagement (CIRCLE) is a leading research center that studies young Americans' civic development and participation. CIRCLE is the premier source of information-facts, trends, evaluations, and best practices-related to youth civic learning and engagement. CIRCLE shares the results of its research with policy makers, practitioners, journalists, and scholars in various disciplines.CIRCLE is part of The Jonathan M. Tisch College of Citizenship and Public Service at Tufts University. Tisch College prepares students to become community leaders and positive change agents and is a national leader in civic education. Tisch College works to engage Tufts students in meaningful community building and public service experiences. As an innovator and incubator, the college collaborates across Tufts University to generate an enduring culture of active citizenship.CIRCLE, is seeking a full-time Researcher to conduct research and to help manage some of CIRCLE's research and evaluation projects. Reporting to the Director of CIRCLE and based on the Medford/Somerville Tufts University Campus, the Researcher will work as part of the CIRCLE team on CIRCLE products and activities. The Researcher will also interact with a larger group of colleagues at Tisch College, and will be expected to participate in various college-wide initiatives such as college-wide events and assistance with student program evaluations. Specific responsibilities include:Serving as an Researcher on a range of research projects that may include secondary data-analysis, literature reviews, field experiments, program evaluations and other original data collection (via survey or other methods);Curating and preparing datasets of various sizes and formats for research use;Producing reports, fact sheets and press releases on timely and relevant topics, often in close collaboration with CIRCLE colleagues;Providing feedback, assistance, and support to colleagues at Tisch College and CIRCLE on research-related tasks, as needed;Representing CIRCLE at a wide range of events including research conferences;Answer queries from reporters about CIRCLE research;Performing administrative duties as needed, as they pertain to CIRCLE operations; andParticipating in activities and meetings that involve Tisch College staff.Basic Requirements:Bachelor's degree.Five (5) years of relevant experience in a team-oriented, deadline driven, dynamic, client responsive work environment.At least two years of significant work experience in an applied research environment (i.e. research as a tool rather than an end). Research assistantships can count but we would prioritize individuals who have worked as full-time staff, rather than student interns on a short-term basis.Strong proficiency in data management, such as cleaning, merging, coding and checking datasets for error and producing codebook.Basic research skills, including ability to execute a research plan using basic descriptive inferential statistical techniques, such as frequencies, crosstabs, t-test, ANOVA, and linear regression.Proficiency with statistical packages (e.g. SPSS, STATA, SAS, R). A willingness to learn SPSS is a plus. Ability and experience with use of syntax/commands to document and execute analysis is strongly preferred.Ability to communicate effectively with practitioners, reporters, scholars, and young people through writing, speech, and visuals.Ability to pay close attention to detail while staying within tight timelines for multiple projects.Strong written communication skills, demonstrated as an ability to produce an accurate, and readable research products on short deadlines.Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite and a survey platform such as Qualtrics.Demonstrable experience working with culturally and ethnically diverse populations of students, faculty, partners, and staff.Evidence of strong commitments to community engagement, sustainable collaborations, diversity, and inclusion.Preferred Qualifications:Experience with multivariate statistical analysis and knowledge of or willingness to learn other statistical analysis approaches (e.g. multi-level modelling, cluster analysis, structural equation modelling, etc).Enthusiasm for youth civic engagement desired; however, prior research in this specific area is not required.Experience with large public datasets.Experience with data visualization (such as data mapping and infographics) preferred.A flexible and curious mindset and a proclivity toward learning and problem-solving.An understanding of the importance of equity in civic learning and engagement opportunities, and can integrate equity into his or her formation of research questions and writing.CIRCLE encourages and is committed to training Researchers with diverse backgrounds.Tufts University is an AA/EO employer and actively seeks candidates from diverse backgrounds. Please see the Tufts University non-discrimination statement.Apply Here

Senior Research Data Analyst, #0710Washington, DCSalary Range: $79,898 - $131,934The position supports the NEA’s strategic objective to focus the energy and resources of its 3 million members toward the promotion of public education by providing professional expertise in data coordination and analysis for the Research Department and the Center for Great Public Schools.Position Summary: The essential functions of this position include conceptualizing and conducting a broad range of data coordination and analysis projects for the Research Department and the other departments in the Center for Great Public Schools. Samples of recent work products (e.g. writing, presentation, and research materials) may be required at interview.Selection Criteria:Tier 1 (Essential):  Proven training and experience in data analysis/science. Experience building, manipulating, querying, and analyzing large databases. Experience with statistical model building and evaluation, hypothesis testing and experimental design. Experience using statistical and analytic software such as R, Stata, SAS, or SPSS. Proven project management skills and ability to allocate time and resources toward the completion of multiple projects with overlapping timelines. Demonstrated ability to synthesize and interpret data analysis findings for technical and non-technical audiences.  Proven oral and written communication skills. Successful references.Tier 2 (Significant): Experience conducting research for an advocacy organization or in a similar environment. Knowledge of business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, TIBCO Spotfire, Microsoft Analytics Platform) and programming languages such as Python. Experience with national datasets, particularly those maintained by NCES, Census Bureau, and other federal agencies (e.g., SASS, CCD, ACS, CPS).  Experience with predictive modeling and/or survey design and analysis. Substantive background in education, social policy, and/or labor issues. The Big Data Platform group within HP Software is a global leader in on-premise and cloud-based enterprise-class analytics solutions. Our innovative solutions help organizations analyze and draw actionable insight from 100% of their data regardless of format, location or type. This includes diverse forms such as text, social media, audio, machine data and even streaming video.We are seeking an individual who can thrive in HP Big Data’s high-energy, fast-paced, and dynamic organization. As a Developer Evangelist within HP Software’s $5B division, this person will play a key role in driving awareness, engagement, and platform use of the innovative HP Haven OnDemand, the platform portfolio of cloud and API-based Big Data solutions that deliver bleeding edge analytics – from text search to face detection – on any device all delivered via the cloud.The Developer EvangelistYou are inspired by the world of machine learning, artificial intelligence, deep neural networks, algorithms, analytics, data mining, data visualization, and the Internet of Things. You hack robots, wearables, and Virtual Reality solutions just because you can and you want to have some fun. If something bugs you enough, you pick up your laptop and crank out some code to solve the problem.The world of startups, incubators, and hackathons excites you. You enjoy mixing with other technologists and creators, and find inspiration in creating innovative technology solutions. You find passion being a mentor, and love the challenge of helping other developers succeed.You prefer your corporate attire to be jeans and a t-shirt, but you clean up well when you need to. You want to travel and make a difference in your community and in the tech world, have a bold vision and be a thought leader. You love to share your skills and ideas with the world, and have an audience on Social Media. This is your stage.You are as comfortable jumping into a project writing client side mobile apps, as you are with traditional server to database, file system I/O, messaging and web application development, and you barely break a sweat as you’re talking an audience through your code as you show how to build your solutions. In other words, you don’t believe in limitations and you’re confident in your abilities.What is HP Haven?We believe that Big Data changes everything and that developers need a platform that can analyze 100% of their Human-, Machine-, and Business-data. Whether they are building on-premise, cloud, hybrid-, or mobile-apps, they need the flexibility to build the right-sized solution, with the right amount of horse-power, and using as little or as much of the platforms and technologies that they choose.HP Haven is the leading Big Data and analytics platform, powered by HP Vertica for advanced analytics and massively parallel processing of structured data, HP IDOL with over 500 functions for analyzing and creating structure from all forms of human information, and HP Distributed-R to build and evaluate predictive models on large data sets. Taking the power to the cloud with HP Haven OnDemand, developers have 50+ REST APIs to search, predict, and analyze with 100% of their data.Are you versatile?As a Developer Evangelist, you will be helping to inspire and mentor developers to build their data-rich applications with HP Haven OnDemand. As our ambassador and advocate for developers, you translate market insights, challenges, and opportunities into new platform and solution requirements that the R&D and product teams can act upon. You get to influence the roadmap, and see your work affecting the platform success directly, through adoption, usage, and technology advancements. You will have a very high profile role within HP and will interface with the brightest developers, most innovative product teams and a great marketing organization. There will never be a dull moment, and the energy that is generated through all that you do will be contagious to others.As an ambassador for HP Haven OnDemand, you are expected to actively identify, engage and nurture your developer communities, have the coding skills required to build cool demos in a variety of programming languages, SDKs and platforms, and possess the support and mentoring skills to help other developers with problem solving. You drive developer awareness, adoption, and usage of our APIs and platform. You will write technical documentation like blog posts, API docs, and code tutorials, using a variety of media and channels to reach your audience.ResponsibilitiesFinding innovative ways to demonstrate Haven OnDemand’s value proposition and leadership to developers through startup weekends, meetups, user groups, online challenges, and hackathonsConnecting with developers to ensure that they are getting the most from our platform, listening to their concerns and helping to tell their stories across Social Media channelsProducing sample applications, example code, developer The PositionThe Web Conversion Analyst is the quantitative specialist responsible for helping drive registration conversion results for TradeKing’s multiple brands. The ideal candidate has strong experience leveraging web analytics tools and providing actionable insights to identify hypothesis-driven opportunities to increase conversion rates. Through A/B testing and other growth-focused initiatives, the candidate will help drive the evolution of TradeKing’s multiple lines of business into an even higher converting consumer site(s). The candidate will consider themself data-driven, thinks strategically about business issues and will have a strong command of digital marketing and digital marketing analytics.This role works independently within the TradeKing Conversion Team as the primary analytical resource and reports into TradeKing’s Analysis team. The position is based in Charlotte, NC.General ResponsibilitiesWork with other members of the Conversion Team to identify opportunities, develop, test, measure and analyze experiments to increase conversion ratesPerform in-depth and ad-hoc analysis of information from multiple data sources (web analytics data, marketing data, transactional data) to provide data-driven business insights leading to improved business resultsManage data from various sources and developing databases and spreadsheets for detailed analysisWork with other members of conversion team to create dashboards and other internal reporting systemsKnowledge & SkillsFamiliarity with A/B or multivariate testing tools and technologies (e.g. Optimizely, Test & Target, et al)Robust experience with Google Analytics, Webtrends, Omniture or a comparable Analytics tool requiredExperience with tag management tools and manipulating javascript-based tagsExtensive SQL knowledge (Intermediate to advanced capabilities) and comfort with enterprise-level databases (such as SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, etc.)Previous experience performing quantitative analysis on datasets, including building an analytical framework, determining and sourcing data, querying the dataset, then developing actionable business insightsFamiliarity working with business intelligence platforms (such as QlikView, Tableau, Looker, etc)Strong Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint abilityDetail oriented, with excellent oral and written communicationDegree in quantitative discipline, such as mathematics or statistics, preferredAdditional Desired Knowledge & SkillsThe ability / desire to perform analysis outside of Microsoft Excel, utilizing statistical or visualization programsBenefitsTradeKing offers a competitive compensation package for qualified full-time employees.All candidates must pass credit and criminal background checks to meet TradeKing and FINRA requirements.TRADEKING GROUP, INC IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

company: Association of American Veterinary Medical Colleges
desc: The Association of American Veterinary Medical Colleges (AAVMC) has an opening for a Data Analyst and Project Manager.  The Data Analyst and Project Manager is responsible primarily for assisting the Associate Executive Director (AED) of Institutional Research and Diversity in the collection, entering, formatting and reporting of data for AAVMC’s institutional research and diversity portfolio.  The position will also provide project support to other program directors as needed.PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESAssists in the development of survey methodologies and implements research projects as directed by the AED.Collaborates on survey development, execution, analysis and reporting of quantitative and qualitative research projects.  Performs data entry for the purpose of updating existing reports and development of new reports.Manages the annual data collection for and preparation of the AAVMC’s Comparative Data Report.Assists the AED in managing the DiVersity Matters Initiative and the Iverson Bell SymposiumTravels occasionally to conduct or present research at AAVMC member institutions and affiliated organizations (approximately 2-3 times per year).Maintains and safeguards the confidentiality of personal information in accordance with AAVMC policy.Provides staff support to various AAVMC committees as assigned (scheduling meetings, taking minutes, preparing meeting materials).Provides minimal administrative support as needed (updating presentations, coordinating events, drafting correspondence).EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONSFour-year degree with prior research experience, preferably in academic policy, economic research or related fieldBasic experience with data analysis is requiredProfessional experience with SPSS is preferredQuantitative analysis experience is required; experience with qualitative analysis is a plusExperience with MS Office programs and internet communication is requiredDatabase experience (MS Access and/or SQL) is a plusProficiency in Excel is requiredExcellent writing and problem-solving skills is requiredAAVMC offers a competitive compensation and benefits package.  To apply for this position, email a cover letter with salary requirements and resume Attn: HR  at HRjobs@raffa.com.  Please include Data Analyst/Project Manager in the subject of your email.  No phone calls please.AAVMC is an equal opportunity employer.  Visit us at www.aavmc.org

job title: Asst VP of Enterprise Information Management/Institutional Research and Chief Data Officer
desc: Assistant Vice President of Enterprise Information Management/Institutional Research and Chief Data OfficerKennesaw State University (KSU), the third largest university in Georgia with new growth and national recognition, seeks an accomplished Assistant Vice President of Enterprise Information Management/ Institutional Research (EIM/IR) and Chief Data Officer (“AVP EIM/IR and CDO") to lead and further develop information management, planning, and analytical support of the institution. The new AVP EIM/IR and CDO will coordinate and oversee the collection, management, and reporting of all data and analytics, including the construction and maintenance of an enterprise data warehouse.Reporting to the Vice President for Operations/Chief Information Officer/Chief Business Officer, the AVP EIM/IR and CDO will oversee a staff of 12, including a newly created Executive Director position that will serve as deputy. A proven leader in the field of enterprise information management and institutional research, the new AVP EIM/IR and CDO will provide strategic direction to the unit through staff development, clear communication and standards, and willingness to learn from and educate university partners.The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker who possesses senior-level institutional research experience, technology savvy, and a keen understanding of higher education. S/he will be a skilled technical expert with an understanding of data warehouses, as well as an ability lead and motivate a talented group of individuals to be a highly accomplished team. Enthusiastic and passionate about information management, the next AVP EIM/IR and CDO will help build an analytical culture at Kennesaw State University.Kennesaw State University has retained Isaacson, Miller, a national executive search firm, to assist with this important search. Inquiries, nominations, and applications should be directed in confidence to: Daniel Rodas, Vice President, Julie Yermack, Associate, Isaacson, Miller, 263 Summer Street, Boston, MA 02210, www.imsearch.com/5345. Electronic submission of material is strongly encouraged.Apply Here

Company DescriptionThe Council for Logistics Research, Inc., (CLR) is a privately owned service disabled business that supports the Air Force and other DoD agencies. CLR has employees in Massachusetts and Virginia. We are headquartered in Arlington, VA and also have a business center in Westford, MA. CLR currently employs acquisition specialists, professional consultants, research analysts, domain engineers, system architects, and functional specialists who support our various projects. CLR's talented employees are dedicated to providing innovative, resourceful, and cost effective business solutions.Job DescriptionCouncil for Logistics Research, Inc. (CLR) seeks creative and motivated individuals to work on one of its many exciting projects. As a Release Engineer, you will report to the Manager of Engineering and support the System Metric and Reporting Tool (SMART) program which provides the Air Force the ability to track and manage its major acquisition programs and data.As Release Engineer with the SMART program, you will automate the continuous integration, pre-production deployment, and production deployment of software applications, components and systems.  The Release Engineer will build, enhance, maintain and document the automated deployment process (IIS, SharePoint 2010/2013, SQL Server) for local development and test environments, manage the Continuous Integration (CI) process while maintaining the software code repository in Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS). The Release Engineer works independently and possesses a level of functional expertise necessary to ensure repeatable builds and deployments in order to meet the software release deadlines. As a Release Engineer, you will:Work with management to identify and document critical requirements for automated builds, continuous integration, automated unit testing, release management, release package preparation and automated deployment and associated reportingDesign, deploy and manage tools to automate the build, test, and release process across multiple development streams in a Continuous integration/Continuous release environmentDevelopment and day-to-day support of automated build and deployment scriptsTroubleshoot build and installation failures and facilitate resolutionTrain and mentor team members on the build/continuous integration process and toolsDeployment to development, test, pre-production and production environments for web-based applications and SharePoint 2010/2013 componentsWork along the boundary between engineering, QA, and operations to ensure that the release process is meeting their short-term and long-term needsPerform static code analysis scans and provide reports to managementInterface with government hosting provider personnel for deployment and production supportDocument build processes, environmental configurations and release plansQualificationsMinimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical field4+ years’ hands-on experience developing and supporting automated build, continuous integration (CI) and automated deployment environments and scriptsSignificant experience using and administrating Microsoft Team Foundation Server (TFS) for software planning, version control, continuous integration and build servicesExperience working with teams developing with Visual Studio .NETExperience with SQL Server 2012; Database backups, restores, queries, etc.Experience using and managing Microsoft SharePoint 2010/2013; SharePoint build packaging and deployment experience a plusExperience using MS Build command line and GUI toolsStrong scripting skills (PowerShell, etc.)Experience developing in an Agile software development environment (Scrum) with cross-functional Scrum teamsExcellent problem-solving, troubleshooting, analytical and debugging skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsMust have the ability to work independently with minimal direction and supervisionAbility to obtain and maintain a Secret ClearancePreferred Qualifications:Experience with virtual machine frameworks and environments, specifically VM Ware systemsExperience with Microsoft networking (Active Directory, etc.)Experience with Microsoft IIS webserver configuration and administrationExperience with HP Fortify Static Source Code Analysis ToolExperience performing Configuration Management (CM)

Company DescriptionBat Blue Networks is an innovative Cloud Security-as-a-Service that leverages a unique Globally distributed Security Abstraction Layer (Global SeAL) technology to deliver uniform and consistent security for all organizational Brick & Mortar facilities, Cloud & SaaS applications, as well as Mobile and IoT assets. Bat Blue is an expansion-stage start-up with stable products and enterprise clients.Our key differentiator is the capability to functions as a comprehensive security infrastructure displacement solution supporting all ports, protocols, and applications, compared to today's proxy point products in-the-cloud.  Bat Blue's technology runs on a proprietary and patent-pending platform that enhances end-to-end performance between 30- 400% over traditional product-based security and tier 1 ISP combinations.The offering is well established having gone into production in 2012 and most recently was responsible for the delivery of the 2014 FIFA Brazil World Cup Games.Job Description Bat Blue is searching for a Vice President of Software Engineering to offload this essential function from the founder who is functioning in multiple roles including CEO and CTO. This is the founder's third successful start-up and he is experienced in successfully transitioning roles to other leaders within the organization.This is a key management role and this individual will be a stakeholder in setting the direction of, and building success with the organization's technology offering. Strong leadership is imperative, as this is a key leadership role within the organization. Integrity, strength of character, ability to thrive under pressure, humility, reliability and surefooted confidence are all integral attributes of the management team and essential for this role.We are extremely passionate about what we do, technology fearless, with a history of creative innovation and execution. We expect the same for this role, which is best suited for a creative, fearless, and passionate, yet humble person who knows how to execute and has staying power.Bat Blue has grown 300+% year-over-year and the leader we seek must have the acumen to initially thrive with a small team, and the experience to grow and manage a successful global development operation.Compensation:  Six-figure base with a healthy equity positionExperience:This is a Player/Coach role which requires fresh and current hands-on development experienceThis role is not for an individual whose primary experience is in the Windows Environment15+ years of software development experience10+ years of leadership experienceDeployed 3 Large Scale or 1 Globally Distributed ApplicationLocation:  Greater New York AreaQualificationsPlanning – Experienced in translating brainstorming sessions into specific qualified and quantified functions. Ability to develop detailed plans with specific goals, priorities, timelines and budgets to effectuate ideas into products and product feature sets.Architecture – Architect that can lead the specification and development effort of the comprehensive software, infrastructure, and application architectures with consideration to timelines, scalability, globalization, security, and privacy.People Manager - Extremely strong manager of people, in-house and external development resources to ensure projects meet or exceed deliverable timelines, functional objectives, and security standards. You need to know how to build a positive work environment while moving the team beyond their comfort zone to do quality work on deadline.Process Manager – Diligent manager of the development lifecycle with agile / waterfall methodologies with the ability to mentor team members in these methodologies.Team Building – Well connected to the community at-large to recruit and attract top-notch talent to grow the team. The proper candidate will know, will have work experience with and be respected by a slew of people from various development disciplines.Discipline – Experience in network and application security is an absolute MUST! Application integrity testing and ethical hacking a very valuable plus.  Security, integrity, and availability of systems is critical.Development – Strong and active developer with experience in:Structured, general purpose programming languages such as C and JavaScripting languages such as Python or RubyREST APIs and API developmentWeb front-ends and web User ExperienceMobile application development for IOS, Android, WindowsLarge scale SQL and NoSQL Database architecture such as H-Base, Elastic Search, MySQL, and Hadoop Eco-systemMastery of the Linux / UNIX operating platform and eco-systemEngaged participant and active awareness of open source projects, their leads and their communities.Ability to deliver high-performing “tuned” applications with a mix of software requirements, platform capabilities, and hardware specs.Experienced in the QA process to drive both internal and external QA of applications for functionality and security testing.Librarian / Historian – A critical must-have is extremely well documented plans and extremely well documented code. Someone who has conviction that documentation is an active part of the process and not an afterthought.

Company DescriptionMDValuate™ is seeking to hire a Database Developer to support our rapidly-expanding organization. The MDValuate platform is a robust healthcare executive intelligence platform that unlocks the power of big data to provide meaningful insights into the performance and value of physician networks. We at MDValuate are driven by the knowledge that healthcare organizations with the strongest physician networks will deliver the highest level of patient care.  Job DescriptionThe developer will be responsible for the analytical and strategic support of this system. This person will participate in a wide range of activities including: developing, evaluating, and implementing key BizExplorer® components used in monitoring and improving physician networks. The developer may also oversee analytical work from other team members on select projects. Responsibilities:Participate in the building and deployment of BizExplorer® components for MDValuate clients.Produces actionable reports showing key performance indicators, identifies areas of improvement into current operations, and displays root cause analysis of problems Creates and tracks metrics for change process performance Gathers and documents complex report and specification requirements Designs and produces standard and ad-hoc reports, dashboards, and various data visualization reporting solutions for end-users using Reporting Services.Participates in the design and development of business intelligence reporting tools Provides support and training to end-users for reporting tools and reports. Ability to model and visualize data aggregation processes Confidently makes presentations to MDValuate executivesCommunicates difficult concepts QualificationsBS, BA or equivalent from an accredited 4-year university or college is preferred (recent MBA grad is ideal) 3+ years of business analysis experience (ideally in a health care organization) Strong Excel reporting and manipulation skills2+ years of T-SQL and dynamic stored procedure experience (Reporting Services experience is a plus) Expert communication skills producing clear and unambiguous deliverables Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

If you crave the familiarity and feel of a small company and still relish the challenge of working for high-profile clients in a fast-paced environment; love the freedom that comes with developing new tools from scratch; have the urge to write a program to automate every annoying repetitive task you’ve ever done - then this is the job for you.You will be one of two data scientists working to build custom tools, primarily in Python, to automate a variety of data reporting and analytics functions in partnership with 1-2 front-end developers. You will be given a great deal of autonomy to be creative in thinking of and developing new features for meeting both internal and client-facing needs in a relaxed and collaborative environment.Responsibilities fall into two broad categories - development and data analysis / reporting.They include maintaining and building tools in Python, MySQL, and Django to automate data reporting and predictive analytics, as well as contributing to and creating client deliverables (memos, reports and conference call participation) regarding fundraising performance and experiment results.Familiarity with Python and SQL is essential - Django, SQLAlchemy, JavaScript, PHP and other languages are a big plus.Development:AnalyticsDevelop new programmatic ways of analyzing data and pulling information from existing datasets and vendor databases;Pursue the acquisition of new data through new and creative channels;Use and improve existing methods of analyzing data to maintain efficiency in fundraising tactics;AutomationAutomate repetitive processes to save time and eliminate propensity for user error and personal boredom;Create programmatic ways to produce internal and client-facing deliverables;Data Management SystemWork with Development Team to audit and advise regarding tools being built into our internal data management system;Develop new tools from scratch via Python and other languages;Maintain data integrity while integrating automatic processes in data management system;Assist in bug squashing and roll out of features, as well as conception of ideas for further extension of the platform;Data Analysis / Reporting:Quality CheckingField questions from co-workers and clients regarding fundraising results in a timely mannerFollow up on potential data integrity issues and correct them as neededClient Facing DeliverablesConduct analysis and issue recommendations regarding fundraising strategy and tacticsDescribe relevant evidence and reasoning in text and graphical formatData AdministrationMaintain the global list of email addresses for clientsMonitor list growth to ensure up to date list compositionExecute data swaps and other inter-firm transactions regarding client dataReportingReport on email fundraising numbers for weekly internal meeting and client callsReport on digital paid media performanceReport out to clients various metrics upon request

Data Scientist / Statistician (Quantitive Analysis)Whitepages is the leading provider of contact information for people and businesses in the U.S. Our suite of products includes a top-40 consumer website, popular mobile apps with over 9 million active users, and a range of enterprise SaaS enterprise products. And with just ~120 staff - each of us has an exceptional opportunity to make an impact.You love working with data, and embrace all facets of working with large complex data setsUnderstanding the data - what is it trying to model, and what are its strengths and weaknesses?Asking the right questions - how do you formulate the right hypothesis, design the right experiment, run the right test?Interpreting results and communicating them effectively - what did the analysis really tell you, and what should we do next?Implementation at scale -- able to assemble the data required to do analyses, and able to work with engineers to put your insights into productionYou have a unique combination of analytic, engineering, and communication skills that allows you to address all aspects of making data valuable, and WhitePages has a unique challenge for you.The WhitePages data graph is both rich (representing complex relationships between people, addresses, phone numbers, businesses, and other contact information like email addresses and social networks) and large (storing more than 2 billion data elements and interpreting 1.5 billion pieces of data per month). As a key member of the data team, you will be responsible for understanding and improving the quality of the WhitePages contact graph.As a Data Scientist at WhitePages you will:Work with other engineering and business groups providing insights that help them do their job betterDesign experiments leading to a better understanding of the data graph and ways to improve its accuracy and coverageEvaluate new data sources to determine how they might improve data qualityAct as the company authority on statistical methodology and experimental designDevelop machine-learning and other algorithmic models that allow us to do better at processing our dataThis is a high-impact position in a small engineering organization, and is a great opportunity for a statistician / data scientist looking to apply state of the art analytics and statistical programming to make huge improvements to the WhitePages key data asset. Apply online.About us:Started in 1997 from a Stanford dorm room, we've been profitable since day one and now serve over 50M unique monthly users. A top-40 web property, WhitePages is headquartered in the heart of downtown Seattle, but also has offices in NYC and Budapest. Our staff enjoy spectacular new offices, a fully stocked kitchen, weekly events (including catered lunch and happy hours), annual company trips and so much more! We have strong company values and culture and would love to share why ours is an opportunity worth considering. We appreciate and respect diversity, and are an equal opportunity employer. For more information, please visit www.whitepagesinc.com.Desired Skills and ExperienceRequirements for this position:Degree in statistics or related field (e.g. a social-science discipline with a quantitative focus).Advanced degree desiredSignificant experience in a role requiring both analytic and data management skills, demonstrated by delivered projectsExperience in a startup environment requiring quick decisions and results desiredExperience with scripting languages (e.g. Perl, Python, Ruby)Experience with standard statistical packages (e.g. R, MATLAB, SAS)Experience with SQL databasesStrong analytic skills with special emphasis on experimental design and hypothesis testingStrong written oral and written communication skills; ability to communicate technical concepts and results to a non-technical audience

company: Blue Cross & Blue Shield of Mississippi
desc: JOB DESCRIPTION:The Senior DB2 Data Base Administrator position is responsible for designing, supporting and implementing data base management system (DBMS) objects, implementing effective DBMS security practices, establishing and monitoring backup schedules and coordinating issues with systems support. Senior Data Base Administrator is responsible to ensure data integrity and performance of production databases and also responsible for the planning, managing, and support of all mainframe database applications.REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business or Management is required.Must have at least 8+ years of DBA experience with DB2 and associated tools in a mainframe environment.Experience with JCL and SQL including DDL, DML, and DCL.Experience with standard IBM utilities and tools including Image Copy, Recovery, REORG, RUNSTATS, Load, Bind, Explain, SPUFI, and QMF.Excellent understanding of relational data base technology.Knowledge of data base modeling and design techniques.Knowledge of effective procedures and techniques involved in data base programming.Understanding of system development lifecycle.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:Knowledge of Netezza database appliance and data ware house modeling is preferred.

Company DescriptionGameAnalytics wants to empower game studios of all sizes to work with data to optimize, distribute and monetize games more effectively.GameAnalytics (SaaS) is a free data and analytics engine for game studios.Technology is the heart of GameAnalytics.We had 14,000 games sign up in the last 20 months.We collect around 100 billion (10TB) in-game events monthly and rising rapidlyWe’re able to handle the most data-intensive games in the world.We’re Unity Gold Partners and among the most popular Unity Assets.We are 27 highly skilled colleagues (ex-Popcap, ex-Wooga, ex-Unity, ex-Klarna in London, Copenhagen and Berlin).GameAnalytics is a well-funded start-up ($8M), backed by world-class business angels and venture capitalists, and we are working with some of the most awesome studios in the world.GameAnalytics has offices in Copenhagen, London and Berlin.Check us out at http://www.gameanalytics.comJob DescriptionOur Engineers are at the heart of GameAnalytics: They are driven, talented experts who contribute not only to the code, but to the entire product.GameAnalytics is looking for a Chief Architect to join our backend team in Berlin to help take us from great to beyond and to ensure that technology and vision is 100% aligned.You’re a highly creative technology visionary, a “rock star” engineering lead, but most importantly an exceptionally talented engineer who will be vital in building a strong technology culture as well as creating a cool vibe as the senior person on the Berlin team (eight back-end engineers).We double our traffic every 3 months on our bespoke analytics platform (AWS/Erlang based), which the team is proudly evolving, operating and scaling as we grow.We are looking for a talented and experienced individual, who can help us to scale and succeed with our analytics product as well as creating value from our massive in-game player data (e.g. engagement, monetization, social events) set across thousands of games and billions of player events.This is a pivotal technical role for a fast growing start-up. We have reason to believe we are good at building amazing software! You are here to help us to become better.Our technology stack:We’re 100% AWS cloud and mobile native, so you’ll be hands-on working with a host of technologies that are leading the next generation of internet scale systems, and you’ll be responsible for our current and future choices. Our current tech stack looks like this, but we’re always evolving it:Ubuntu on EC2AngularJS, NGINX, TornadoWeb, Sass, Grunt, Gulp, Bower, npmErlang, S3, DynamoDB, Redshift, EMR with Python, Pig (PigPen)To succeed in this role you will:Engage with and own the technical vision, operationally as part of our teams, in the management group and outbound towards the marketInfuse engineering practice into the organisationJoin forces with the lead developers to find the right solutionsTake ownership of our architecture and data visionBe hands-on with writing codeKey responsibilities:Contribute to a long-term product vision, help build and maintain the roadmapOwn the architectureBe the senior person in BerlinEnsure our platform continues to scale at a low price pointWork closely with the organization to drive products from inception to launchWe are looking for someone with:Start-up mindset and experienceHands-on ability to engage in coding as neededExperience in gaming or analyticsSolid foundation in maths or data scienceProven architecture experience at scaleManagement experienceFamiliarity with the Amazon stackHands-on big data experienceFnctional programming skills (Erlang is a plus)Additional InformationKeywords: #chief architect, #data, #analytics, #gaming #video games #Erlang #datamining #data mining #machine learning #perfectionist #visionary #passionate #geniusThis is a unique chance to get in early with a huge upside. You'll have tons of freedom and responsibility in a world-class start-up that has massive potential and big data challenges that are among the biggest in the world.Salary is very competitive and includes stock options.

job title: Senior Software Engineer, Distributed Data Systems
desc: New RelicSenior Software Engineer, Distributed Data SystemsPortland, ORAt New Relic, we delight our customers by helping them understand their world via our SaaS platform. Thousands of customers use our products every day to monitor status, improve performance and diagnose issues in software, infrastructure and operations. The total data stream is bigger than Twitter’s. Now you can be part of it!The Data Services team designs, creates, assembles and operates the machinery that powers all of the underlying data ingestion, storage and query functionality that make the platform go. We accept a stupendous amount of data from applications, servers, mobile devices and browsers every minute of every day, and there is more each day than the day before. We’re looking for someone special to help us out. If joining the highly competent DevOps team responsible for high-performance data infrastructure critical to the success of a rapidly growing, successful company sounds like fun, we want to know about it.New Relic is a great place to work, not because the Oregonian said so, not because the panoramic views of Portland from the office are amazing, not because we’re located in the heart of Portland’s vibrant urban culture, and not because we get a great feeling every day due to our software enabling other companies to do their best work. That’s all true, but what’s special about New Relic is the culture. We treat you like an adult, we strive to make you happy and successful, we look for improvement rather than blame, and most of all we value your talents and the unique contribution your experience, point of view, and innovation can make to product greatness and customer success.Note that we view the difference between regular and senior software engineers differently than some other companies do. At New Relic, being senior does not just mean that you have a very high degree of technical competence. You also perform at a higher level with regard to self-direction, team coordination, and strategic outlook and direction than a regular software engineer. This means you not only solve current issues, but also anticipate, plan and coordinate solutions before they become emergencies.For Best Consideration, You:Are a professional software engineer and have been for several years.Live and breathe multi-process, multi-threaded, concurrency, asynchrony, server.Have done significant commercial work using statically typed languages.Have substantial experience in both relational and noSQL databases.Like working in a startup or startup-like setting.  Bonus points for experience with Kafka, AWS, Java NIO, Memcached, Redis, Cassandra, message-driven architectures, DevOps.You also: Communicate at both a tactical and strategic level as needed for project excellence.Like and are effective at coordinating multi-person projects, including cross-team.Prefer a polite and collegial work environment.Solicit and incorporate feedback from multiple sources into your process.  To Apply, Please Send Us: A copy of your resume.A cover letter describing why this role appeals to you.  We look forward to hearing from you! A little about us:New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our 90,000 customers use New Relic every day to optimize more than three million applications. New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 & 2014 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.Our office is in the tech mecca of Portland, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats and great coffee. We provide competitive compensation including stock options and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.)—all while maintaining the energy, agility and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customer’s means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.To get started, click on the link below.https://hire.jobvite.com/j?cj=od590fwb&s=DataJobs

Duties include but are not limited to; all aspects of order entry, customer service, general clerical duties, and special projects as requested. This position requires a rapid development of product knowledge, computer skills, and excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. Job involves using independent judgement.Key Responsibilities include, but not limited to:Responsible for the accurate processing of customer orders.Responsible for maintaining excellent customer relationships with all internals and all external customers.Stay current on issues pertaining to all orders in the ordering process.Required to analyze information and exercise a high degree of professionalism to insure both the customer needs and the company’s well-being are being met. Furthermore, assumes responsibility for order entry errors, which can be costly. For this reason accuracy, with attention to detail, in a timely manner is a must.Additionally, will actively resolve problems relating to orders (obtaining necessary information for completion of the ordering process, cancellations, changes, order errors). Proper judgement must be exercised when dealing with order discrepancy to insure complete customer satisfaction.Meticulously apply customer’s price lists and agreements.Passionately take responsibility for all customers’ issues.Autonomously carry out company policy and procedures.Create systems to ensure status is current on pricing and inventory variations.Communicate and coordinate with the warehouse to ensure customer requirements are executed in a timely fashion.Liaise with sales, accounting and warehouse staff regularly with team spirit.Flag issues or procedures that require updating.RequirementsWell organized.Customer oriented.Meticulous. Accurate workAble to work in a fast paced environment and remain customer focused.Able to multi-task.Able to troubleshoot, solve problems within company processes.Flexible and open to new challenges.
location: One Barnes-Jewish Hospital PlazaSt. Louis, MO 63110

desc: Blue Water Satellite is searching for a mathematically literate data scientist for the role of Senior Scientist supporting the Chief Technology Officer of the company.  Principal job functions will be developing and exercising algorithms for new satellite, aircraft and drone deployed lidar, multispectral and hyperspectral imagers.Job Requirements:The ideal candidate will have a PhD in Mathematics, Physics or Computer Science, a thorough background in basic mathematics including linear algebra, functional analysis, differential geometry, differential and integral equations, and probability and statistics.  Significant experience with kernel based statistical learning theory, especially Support Vector Machines, is essential.  Image processing experience is highly desirable.  The candidate should also be fluent in MATLAB and C++ and be comfortable manipulating large data sets.

The National Association of Manufacturers is seeking an experienced Director, Research and Data Mining to be a part of its dynamic and responsive DC-based membership team. The Director, Director, Research and Data Mining is an exempt level position reporting to the VP, Membership. The position responsibilities include the following:SUMMARY:  The position envisions, executes, and oversees the processes necessary to deliver exceptional quality data regarding NAM members and prospects to Membership, while assisting and collaborating with other departments across the organization on meeting their related data needs.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.Source, explore, develop, test, and mine sources of data to assist the NAM’s membership efforts in both sales and retention. Expand the number and diversity of data sources – both free and commercial – in ways that provide measurable improvements in data depth, quality, and usability.  Work closely with external and internal technical resources to ensure successful data imports and integrations. (40%)Coordinate with other internal staff to determine overlapping needs for prospect and/or member data and how those needs can be satisfied efficiently and economically.  Strive to build ongoing processes that help ensure the quality and relevance of the broader data streams over time.  When necessary, provide data for specific marketing projects or communication pieces, such as the NAM's annual report, marketing letters, surveys and brochures. (20%)Ensure that the data necessary for targeted mailings, sales and retention campaigns is readily available and reliable.  Identify and advocate for the tools necessary to allow the NAM’s key data consumers to identify and retrieve this data themselves whenever possible. (15%)Manage identification of and subscription to the tools and sources necessary to track and report industry trends, profitable industries, IPOs and M&A transactions, and other important events or data points to the Field Division in order to facilitate the relevant sales and retention actions. (10%)Track all director commitment activity for retention and dues increases. (10%)Perform other duties to assist sales team when necessary, such as helping with PowerPoint presentations, letter merging and mailings or other special projects. (5%)Type and Purpose of ContactsInternally: Headquarters (policy, public affairs, marketing and member services departments) and field staff to discuss issue impact, explore data needs and cross-reference opportunities, and provide sales tools; NAM leadership to seek assistance with major prospects and member companies for dues increases, member involvement or retention.Externally: Prospect and member companies to obtain or verify information.  Data vendors, service providers, and partners to ensure capabilities and results.Supervisory Responsibilities: Supervises jointly the Research AssistantDegree of Supervision Received: Minimal on day-to-day activities, though work is reviewed closely by other staff.Examples of Decision MakingOn own authority: How to identify data needs, test assumptions and sources, perform research, run reports and present findings; how to work effectively with key representatives in other departments to identify overlapping and related data needs; how to coordinate research activities with division staff.With approval of higher authority: Contracting with a data vendor or other third party service provider; Assignment of prospects to sales team; major changes to data or company information.                      Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Education and/or Experience                                             College degree (preferably in marketing, business, finance); five to eight years’ experience in research and database managementKnowledge/Skills/Abilities:Working knowledge of database structure, Transact-SQL Skills a significant plusWorking knowledge of prospect sales and lead generation systemsStrong interpersonal, collaborative and organizational skillsStrong skills in project management and presentationsStrong communication skills- oral and writtenGood judgmentStrong computer skills (Microsoft Office Suite)Ability to learn the NAM's databaseAbility to work collaboratively in a team environmentAbility to handle pressure in a deadline driven environmentThe National Association of Manufacturers (NAM) is the largest manufacturing association in the United States and one of the nation’s most influential advocates for manufacturing. By joining the NAM team, you become one of a spirited and dynamic team that is driven to succeed. The NAM offers an outstanding salary and benefits package that includes health, dental, and vision insurance, life, short-term and long-term disability, three weeks of vacation to start, flexible spending accounts, SmarTrip, and a 401(k) Salary Deferral plan with employer match and contributions. Position also has an opportunity to earn an annual bonus based on individual, team and organizational success. Come be a part of a fast paced team passionate about keeping the United States the world leader in manufacturing.To apply go to www.nam.org/Careers.

Company DescriptionKenra Professional®, a wholly owned subsidiary of Henkel Consumer Goods, is a fast-growing professional beauty company that is dedicated to providing performance-driven hair care products that give our loyal stylists and customers the trust and confidence to achieve their desired style.  Our products are developed and manufactured to exceptionally high standards and can be found in quality salons throughout North America.   The Kenra Professional Sales Team is an industry leader and our continued success stems from our culture that emphasizes teamwork, collaboration and responsibility for sales performance.  We pride ourselves on constantly measuring our performance through innovative metrics driven from sales and customer data, both internal and external.Job DescriptionThe Database Applications Administrator we seek has proven technical abilities, but also enjoys working in a team environment, is eager to embrace broad and varied responsibilities, and is dedicated to serving his/her internal customers. CLR's talented employees are dedicated to providing innovative, resourceful, and cost effective business solutions.Job DescriptionThe Senior Analyst will provide Executive-level analysis support to Secretary of the AF Acquisition Integration Directorate (SAF/AQX) to ensure senior leaders have the desired Acquisition program analysis and insights to make informed program decisions. The analyst will apply a broad range of analytical methodologies to develop briefings and reports that will assist AQX in continuing their transformation efforts and measure progress against a series of metrics.DutiesThe incumbent will provide Data analysis, transformation, and report templates in both prototype and development environments to support information needs of AQXL and its customers; testing to enhance the user experience component of AQ Analytics; updating and refreshing monthly data of AQ_Analytics prototype currently being used to provide information to AQXL and its customers; developing executive reports including the following:AQXL War Room Charts (also used by DEPSECAF) detailed funding, program performance and financial data on Top 25 Air Force firms; Monthly Assessment Report (MAR) - a detailed, 77 page report that shows AQ program performance in easy-to-read format, PEO, ACAT, company, adverse changes, and trends. Detailed report on the requested Company (Corporate Portfolio Package), to include all contract awards in past five years, broken out by contract type and DoD funding organization.Incumbent must have advanced experience with Excel, statistics and analysis, database design and construction.Work with and coordinate efforts with diverse financial or acquisition groups with DoD, the Federal government, and industryAuthor messages, white papers, bullet background papers, or other documents as needed Develop documentation and presentations for delivery to clientsHelp resolve problems and ensure customer satisfactionFoster positive client relationshipsQualificationsBachelor's degree in Operations Research, Mathematics, and/or Computer ScienceDynamic personality that can adapt to changing requirementsAdvanced experience in Microsoft Office applicationsFamiliarity with Air Force operations, acquisition programs and types of data8+ years relevant experienceExtensive experience in Excel, database design and constructionReliable, self-motivated, and focused on qualityAbility to work as part of a teamExceptional written and verbal communication skills

Computer Science, Math, Physics or equivalent experienceKnowledge of BI Analytic tools a plusKnowledge and experience with Hadoop/Hive a plus

The Single Molecule Array (Simoa™) technology at the heart of the platform enables the detection and quantification of biomarkers previously difficult or impossible to measure, opening up new applications to address significant unmet needs in life science research, in-vitro diagnostics, companion diagnostics, blood screening, and more. Quanterix is a venture capital backed company and the exclusive licensee of a broad intellectual property portfolio initially developed at Tufts University by Dr. David Walt, scientific founder of Quanterix and Illumina (NASDAQ: ILMN).Job DescriptionAre you currently utilizing your scientific programming and image analysis skills to develop ground breaking scientific tools with the latest solution to collect and organize vast amount of data generated by company’s biological analyzers.Create a web-based data mining platform to enable data analytics and reporting that will drive business and engineering decisions.Prioritize, design, plan, implement, and own features centered on data analysis.Work with internal and external customers on improving current features.Solve challenging problems in algorithms, scalability, performance, and API design.Peer review of code, development processes, and system architectures.QualificationsRequired Skills & ExperienceFlexible, curiosity-driven, self-starting developer with excellent cross-disciplinary teamwork and communication skills.Knowledge of SQL, SQL Server and data warehousing techniques.Experience working with very large data sets.Strong programming skills in at least one of the following languages: C#, Java, C++, C.Knowledge of a web-development platform for rapid deployment of data-centric applications.Experience designing and developing algorithms to efficiently process terabytes of data.Familiarity with development tools: version control, bug tracking, Visual Studio, ReSharper, NUnit.Fundamental software concepts: the software development life cycle; concurrent programming; object-oriented programming; functional programming; database storage; data structures; server/client model; MVC in UI.BS, MS or PhD in Computer Science or a related Engineering discipline.Years of experience?  We are looking for excellence.  If you have previously released commercial software, we would like to talk to you.Desired Skills & ExperienceComputer science, math or biochemistry background is a big plus.Scientific computing, machine learningData analytics, statistics and probabilityExperience with C, C++, and LINQ or asynchronous methods in .NET 4.5 and ImageJ experience.Familiarity with dependency injection, test-driven development, object-relational mapping, mocking, or continuous integration.
