job title: Front-End Web Developer - Next Gen Data Science
desc: Company DescriptionJoin Ufora to develop software for the most advanced data science teams on the planet.Ufora’s data science customers range in requirements from quants in finance and engineers at NASA to doctors in emergency rooms and ahead-of-the-curve school systems. As a result, we develop interfaces for everything from IDEs to business intelligence tools. As a Front End Developer, you will help us create and refine software that transforms people’s ability to make sense of vast amounts of critical data.Job DescriptionBuild beautiful, engaging web interfaces to manage the data science workflow and support stunning data visualizations.What you'll be doing:Working with a team of product managers, UX designers, and engineers to design and build new features and interfacesContributing to design discussions for both front-end interaction and engineering systemsLearning new software languagesCollaborating on product and feature planningQualificationsYou'll need:JavaScript skills, and of course, HTML5 and CSS. CoffeeScript a plus.Experience with client-side frameworks, Backbone or Angular.Familiarity with Node.Have controlled source with git.Some experience building real-time apps (e.g. with Socket.io)Extra Points:Python a huge plus.Experience with visualization libraries like d3.js.Visual design skills or graphic design training.Experience with a (relatively) modern front-end toolchain: grunt, bower, etc.

At Spotify, we’re focused on providing the right music for every moment. We’ve connected tens of millions of people to their favorite songs and created a service that people use to discover and share music they love. We’re currently in 55+ markets and growing fast!As the Content & Distribution Analytics Manager, you will be part of Spotify’s Analytics team and be responsible for guiding Spotify’s content decisions by crunching large data sets, analyzing the results, and gaining insight. The Content & Distribution organization consists of Label Relations, Artist Services, Licensing and Content Operations. Responsibilities:Understand the impact of content on Spotify,  as well as the impact of Spotify on content providers, through both internal and external data analysis Defining how these findings should influence the strategy and tactic of Content & DistributionLead and develop a global analytics team; on a day-to-day basis, you will be leading the team, while also collaborating on multiple projectsYou will work very closely with the leadership of Content & Distribution, as well as peers on on the broader Analytics team (Product Analytics, Tech Analytics, Marketing Analytic and, Ad sales Analytics) Requirements:  3-5 years of experience working with analysis; posess domain expertise in the music industryStrong technical competence to perform advanced analytics: Coding skills (such as python, java, C) and experience performing analysis with large datasets, analytics tools experience (SPSS, R, excel, SQL, HIVE, Hadoop).Demonstrated intellectual curiosity, logical thinking, and the ability to solve complex problems that may not always be well-definedDemonstrated ability to condense analysis into actionable insights to inform business decisions and influence / transform business performance; understand business models and high level strategy.Possess statistical competence; demonstrated experience with hands-on statistical modeling (such as regression modeling, a/b testing, significance testing etc), knowledge about machine learning (such as predictive modeling, decision trees, classification models, clustering techniques), knowledge about statistical research methods (such as conjoint survey models, segmentation survey methods, etc)

We are looking for an outstanding Senior Product Development Analyst to guide Spotify’s product decisions by crunching large data sets, analyzing the results and gaining insight.We collect and glean vast amounts of data on a daily basis to learn more about Spotify: our users, artist trends, advertisement effectiveness and much more. Our team's role is to make Spotify a better company through the use of data-driven decision making.Responsibilities:Support the global product organization through analyzing our user patterns, trends, habits, etc.Solve complex business problems with a structured approachReach valuable data- driven conclusions and recommendationsTake ownership over specific areas of the product, i.e. social, search, startpage, etc.Work cross functionally with product owners, developers and designersRequirements:Intellectual curiosity, logical thinking, and the ability to solve complex problems that may not always be well-definedPassion for numbers, statistics as well as strong business and financial acumenProven ability to collaborate cross-functionally3-5 years of experience working with analysis in the digital spaceExperience in general service programming (Python, Java, etc.)Experience with modeling in ExcelUndergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline is required (e.g. Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Economics, etc.)Most of the Spotify analytics backend is written in Python, but previous experience with Python is not required. If you’re the one we’re looking for, you want to grow and learning new programming languages is something you are enticed by!You should preferably have worked with large data sets before, the larger, the better. Experience with Hadoop and MapReduce is definitely something we value.

At Spotify, we’re focused on providing the right music for every moment. We’ve connected tens of millions of people to their favorite songs and created a service that people use to discover and share music they love. We’re currently in 55+ markets and growing fast!As the Marketing Analytics Manager, you will be part of Spotify’s Analytics team and be responsible for guiding Spotify’s marketing decisions by crunching large data sets, analyzing the results, and gaining insight.We collect and analyze vast amounts of data on a daily basis to learn more and about Spotify: our consumers, behaviors, marketing activities, artist performance, advertisement effectiveness and much more. Through analyzing both internal and external data, the Marketing Analytics team is responsible for understanding the consumers, which in turn help guide our day-to-day marketing activities as well as our global marketing strategy.Responsibilities:Understand Spotify’s consumers through both internal and external data analysis; helping to define how these findings should influence global marketing effortsEstablish innovative strategies to understand and solve complex marketing problems: reach valuable data driven insights, through the discovery of patterns and trends; testing and evaluating various marketing mix models; formulating and designing data pipelines to monitor key metrics for the marketing teamsLead and develop a global analytics team; on a day-to-day basis, you will be leading the team, but also collaborating and participating hands-on in multiple projectsYou will work very closely with the CMO, and various leaders in the marketing organization; the team as a whole will be supporting the entire marketing org, while working closely with peers on the broader analytics team (Product Analytics, Tech Analytics, Content & Distribution Analytics, Ad sales Analytics) Requirements: 7-10 years of professional experience in the field of analytics/marketing/consultingMarketing domain expertise: Hands-on experience from tactical marketing analytics (such as marketing mix and attribution modeling, campaign performance analysis, ROI estimates, life time value modeling) and consumer-oriented marketing analysis (segmentations, user survey, storytelling about consumers, brand positioning, etc.)Strong technical competence to perform advanced analytics: Coding skills (such as python,java,c), experience performing analysis with large datasets, analytics tools experience (SPSS, R, excel, SQL, HIVE, hadoop), experience from 3rd party marketing tools (such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Adobe Marketing Cloud)Experience with hands-on statistical modeling (such as regression modeling, a/b testing, significance testing etc), knowledge about machine learning (such as predictive modeling, decision trees, classification models, clustering techniques), knowledge about statistical research methods (such as conjoint survey models, segmentation survey methods, etc) Skilled at condensing analysis into actionable insights to inform business decisions within marketing, and influence / transform business performance; understand business models and high level strategyExperience managing a team: proven ability to build successful teams, while possessing a collaborative, nonhierarchical and humble leadership style

Company DescriptionOpen Data Group is a small, smart and supportive firm that provides management consulting services, outsourced analytical services, analytic staffing, and expert witnesses broadly related to data and analytics. It has been building predictive models over big data for over ten years and has introduced a variety of innovative technology related to predictive modeling and analytic architectures.  This includes assisting clients to move away from reliance on rules-based systems to protect their networks.  Your knowledge of network behavior and attack vectors will contribute to the design and implementation of predictive models into large-scale, high-speed networks. With a regarded and successful track record in "big-data" solutions, Open Data offers challenging problems, autonomy, smart colleagues, competitive salaries and attractive benefits. Job DescriptionOpen Data is looking for an experienced malware / network security engineer. You will work with the modeling and software development teams to build predictive and statistical models to identify malicious behavior in customer networks. You will  monitor and analyze logs and alerts from a variety of technology and determine the potential security impact from the alerts and traffic anomalies on networks.  Participate in design and testing of predictive analytics over complex data networks.QualificationsMalwareSolid understanding of dynamic/static analysis of malware.Familiar with common categories of malware and characteristics of each.Awareness and understanding of the current threat landscape.NetworkingSolid background in network traffic analysisProficient knowledge of networking protocolsIntimate knowledge of Network Traffic Collection and AnalysisAbility to interface with other industry investigators and peers on subjects related to information securityApplicant must have at least 2 years of professional development experienceOther SkillsAbility to write about your technical investigation and the results to technical and business audiencesExperience in encryption / obfuscation a plusExperience with Linux / UNIXExperience with Java or Python a plusGood understanding of data privacy laws and experience interacting with Legal and Compliance professionalsBackground in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field of concentration.Any of the following certifications: EnCase Certified Examiner (EnCE), Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE), Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), Global Certified Incident Handler (GCIH), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)

Company DescriptionHonest Office is an internet retailer that sells office supplies and other consumer products on various internet marketplaces. In 2012, 2013, and 2014 we achieved a spot on the Internet Retailer Top 1000 list. We were also recently recognized by Internet Retailer Magazine as one of the country's fastest growing e-retailers.  We work hard but we also like to enjoy ourselves while doing it. We strongly believe in enjoying what you do for work!Job DescriptionWe are looking for a part-time Inventory Analyst to help manage our inventory to optimize sales and ROI. This role involves no physical handling of inventory. The schedule for this team member is flexible to accommodate for their busy schedule.The Inventory Analyst is responsible for actively monitor inventory to ensure consistent stock to meet demand while minimizing costs and inventory investment. The online marketplace changes constantly and existing items must be continuously audited to react to those changes. This team member will also be involved in analyzing new products for the company to sell.This is an important position within Honest Office because the day-to-day decisions have a direct impact on the performance of the organization. This role requires an analytical and problem-solving mindset. Advanced computer skills are necessary to be successful in this position. The right candidate will be an entrepreneurial person who can work independently and enjoys performing a variety of tasks.This role is part time and the schedule is flexible, but will involve approximately 20-30 hours of work each week. Although the schedule is flexible, the majority of work should be performed during normal business hours. We believe in work-life balance which means this may be the perfect position for someone looking for a flexible part-time role to fit their busy schedule. This position is based at our office here in Unionville, CT and is not remote.Duties:Analyze inventory and sales trendsMonitor inventory turnoverMaintain and manage safety stock levels for all itemsContinuous analysis of inventory processes and procedures in order to improve the accuracy, timely information exchange, and data accuracy of all inventory.Audit inventory to ensure profitability of each SKU.QualificationsExcellent analytical and numerical skills.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Must be well organized, detail oriented and able to prioritize tasks.Expertise in Microsoft Excel a must.Bachelors degree is preferred.Additional InformationWe believe in work-life balance so this may be the perfect position for someone looking for a flexible part-time role to fit their busy schedule. Compensation can be discussed during an interview. This is not a position for someone that is looking for a full-time position but willing to settle for a part-time position.

job title: HPC Visualization and Data Analysis Software Developer
desc: Company DescriptionFounded in 1998, Kitware is a leader in the creation and support of open-source software and state-of-the-art technology, and is one of the fastest growing software companies in the country. Kitware leverages its diverse technical expertise to provide advanced custom solutions for a host of complex technical problems.Job DescriptionKitware, Inc. is actively seeking a talented HPC Visualization and Data Analysis Software Developer to join our Scientific Computing team.  Candidates will create, develop and improve leading edge visualization software solutions in the context of an open-source and highly collaborative development model.By joining our team you will participate in a dynamic work environment with exceptionally talented co-workers; and collaborate with esteemed researchers from around the world by:developing visualization and analysis tools for use on HPC platforms;developing distributed memory parallel algorithms for data analysis;compiling and maintaining software on supercomputers;performing scalability studies;optimizing distributed parallel codes; anddebugging distributed parallel codes.QualificationsQualified candidates will have 4 or more years experience in developing HPC applications and a bachelors degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.  This is an opportunity for you to contribute to large open-source projects and communities, such as VTK and ParaView, through your exceptional skill in C++, your solid experience with MPI and your knowledge of Unix and Linux operating systems.  The most desirable candidates will have familiarity with scientific visualization software, knowledge of Python and/or experience with parallel I/O.Additional InformationCandidates that have a strong preference should indicate their preferred office location somewhere in their cover letter or resume.  Available offices include Clifton Park, NY; Carrboro, NC or Santa Fe, NM.Kitware team members enjoy our small company environment, flexibility in work assignments, and the high levels of independence and responsibility.  Besides a great work environment, our comprehensive benefits package includes flexible working hours, six weeks paid time off, a computer hardware budget, 401(k), health insurance, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, flexible spending account, visa processing, a generous compensation plan (that compensates employees for all hours worked – not just the first 40) and free coffee, drinks and snacks.Kitware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and proudly supports Affirmative Action. Please, no recruiters or agencies without a previously signed contract.

Company DescriptionFounded in 1998, Kitware is a leader in the creation and support of open-source software and state-of-the-art technology, and is one of the fastest growing software companies in the country. Kitware leverages its diverse technical expertise to provide advanced custom solutions for a host of complex technical problems.Job DescriptionKitware is seeking to hire highly skilled Research and Development Engineers (R&D Engineers) to join our Scientific Computing team and contribute to our information and scientific visualization efforts.  A passion for C++ programming to solve challenging visualization problems is required.Kitware collaborates on basic and applied research and development projects that span all forms of data visualization.  Our collaborators include the top universities from around the world, national research labs, medical device manufacturers, car manufacturers, oil and gas companies, financial institutes, and many others.  Our efforts build upon our extensive C++ software libraries and applications, such as VTK, VES, Slicer, and ParaView.By joining our team you will participate in a dynamic work environment with exceptionally talented coworkers who are committed to high-quality development practices.  You will collaborate with esteemed researchers from around the world in the following ways:Create next-generation, open-source software for mobile, tablet, web, desktop, and supercomputing platforms.Develop advanced information and scientific visualization systems for analyzing data from the newest medical imaging devices, fusions of genomics and other ‘omic data from individuals and populations, simulations from the largest supercomputers, and signals at all scales of time and space.Deploy software applications and infrastructure that are used by people, every day, around the world, to improve the world.QualificationsOutstanding C++ skills, Strong Javascript skillsA passion for C++ programming and for developing and delivering practical solutions to challenging data analysis problemsB.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in computer science or a related field with corresponding emphasis on visualization, informatics, and good software development practicesExceptional communication skillsGrant writing and publication experience is a bonusAdditional InformationCandidates that have a strong preference should indicate their preferred office location somewhere in their cover letter or resume.  Available offices include Clifton Park, NY; Carrboro, NC or Santa Fe, NM.Kitware team members enjoy a small company environment, flexibility in work assignments, and high levels of independence and responsibility.  Besides a great work environment, our comprehensive benefits package includes a generous compensation plan, flexible working hours, six weeks paid time off, 401(k), health insurance, life insurance, short- and long-term disability insurance, bonus plan, and free coffee, drinks and snacks.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Web Analytics ManagerSpringbox seeks a collaborative, hands-on Web Analytics Manager to lead data-driven initiatives across our organization, from research and insights, to testing measurement and ongoing reporting. This is a mid-senior level role, reporting to the Director of Strategy & Analytics.ResponsibilitiesIdentify key business insights from web, customer, competitive, social, SEO, market research analytics. Move beyond numbers to create actionable recommendations for demand/lead generation, digital acquisition, eCommerce optimization, branding, creative, content marketing, user experience and social media. Define and benchmark appropriate business KPIs for marketing objectivesProvide measurement and reporting in order to optimize clients’ websites, social media, digital campaigns and mobile applications. Build and execute ongoing testing plans, including A/B and multivariate testing. Own the strategic planning, implementation and reporting of all tagging and tracking needs for these initiatives. Report findings to internal teams and clientManage the collection, storage and reporting for our proprietary client, market and research dataQualificationsThe ideal candidate has deep experience synthesizing complex qualitative and quantitative data to form clear, well-supported recommendations for non-technical audiences. Superior candidates are team collaborators, able to work at a senior level across multiple projects, and possess exemplary follow-through on execution of their work. As well, top candidates possess the following work experience:4-7 years of employment experience in Web Analytics, Business Intelligence or an equivalent role. Client-facing experience preferredAdvanced Google Analytics (GA) certification (301) or equivalent knowledge. Advanced experience in GA advanced segmentation, URL/element event tracking, custom reporting for digital campaigns. Expert-level experience with Adobe SiteCatalystTagging, tracking and reporting of A/B/multivariate optimization tests, using software such as Adobe Test & Target, Optimizely or MonetateTagging, tracking and reporting for campaigns and digital strategies that leverage marketing automation platforms, such as Eloqua and MarketoTagging, tracking and reporting for inbound campaigns using organic/paid search keywords, paid search landing pages, remarketing (email), retargeting (display) and social advertising networksExperience working with project management teams to estimate costs, resources and timing for all analytics and optimization activitiesSocial media analytics, measurement and reporting; monitoring social media to collect customer insights and collect customer profiling dataNice-to-HavesExperience with database management and ETL processesWeb development experienceData visualizations and reporting dashboard interfaces.Familiarity with SEO/SEM, content marketing, email marketing and digital marketing best practices Perks (because it matters, right?):Wear what you want to work, up to a point (no speedos)Fully stocked “beverage” refrigeratorsPing-Pong table, pool table, shuffleboard and Xbox360 w/KinectLocated downtown at 7th and Congress AvenueModern, comfortable workplace, with areas to chill when you need itFlexible hours, some of us aren’t morning peopleBring your best friend to work (dogs allowed)Paid parking and paid benefitsRelocation assistance available for this opportunity!

Company DescriptionWe are a determined (funded) start-up working to reinvent the way insights into human behaviors and opinions are collected and understood. Our software is innovative and is disrupting the market we have entered.  Intuitive visualization around consumer insight and perceptions is one of our key business differentiators, enabling our customers to make impactful decisions quickly.Oculus360 is based in Dallas and our preference is that our employees are too.  We’re a team of creative, passionate, driven, and fun-loving people who work hard and know how to celebrate our success.  We have all the perks associated with a great start-up; free lunches, stocked kitchen, casual and flexible environment, excellent benefits, generous PTO, and equity. Job DescriptionWe are looking to add a Sr. Data Scientist to help turn our vision in to reality.This is a great opportunity for a hands-on candidate with a strong engineering foundation and a passion for language analysis, linguistic variation, and semantics. We are leading the pack using NLP in a non-traditional way.  You should be comfortable with new thinking and conquering the unknown.  Be prepared for intellectual challenge!Requirements and Qualifications:3+ years strong experience with NLP, specifically in the professional areas ofinformation extractionentity recognitionrelationship extractionsemantic role labeling2 – 5 years machine learning experience with large datasetsExperience with Framenet a plusStrong communication skills; specifically, you can tell a clear story with dataSensitivity to different mediums of expression (Twitter, Facebook, customer reviews, etc.)Excellence in statistical learning techniques including classifiers, multivariate regression, Logit, SVM, Bagging, Boosting, Decision Trees, clusteringMS degree in Statistics, Mathematics, CS, or something applicable to your workAdditional qualities that will help you succeed here:Comfortable in a small organization, with ability to take technical leadership / mentorship role within a small, fast moving, highly collaborative effortProduct development experienceYou see patterns where others can’t make sense

Company DescriptionByAllAccounts, a Morningstar company, is the only provider of intelligent data aggregation for financial services companies and the platforms on which their businesses depend.  We have more than a decade of experience in gathering and transforming complex financial account data from thousands of institutions.This is an exciting time for the company as we are bringing new technology to the financial services market, our products are proven, our client list expanding, and we are growing!Job DescriptionThe Technical Support Representative will provide first and second-line technical support to corporate customers and their clients for ByAllAccounts’ suite of financial software products.  The representative is responsible for intake, troubleshooting, triage, and monitoring of reported product issues.  This person interacts directly with product users via phone or email and works closely with product development to drive issues to completion and communicate issue resolution to customers.  Other responsibilities include contributing to FAQ and support documentation to be used by customers and their clients, and communicating customer feedback to the product development team. Support coverage hours are Monday-Friday, 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM, excluding financial market and company holidays. QualificationsThe ideal candidate will have the Company DescriptionChaos Group is a leading provider of state of the art rendering solutions for the media, entertainment, and design industries. job title: Senior PHP Web Developer (remote or onsite)

Company DescriptionA leading provider of software and services in the Media & Entertainment space with marquis clients both Nationally and internationally.Job DescriptionRSG Media Systems, a recognized leader in the Media & Entertainment domain, is seeking a bright, talented mid-level ASP .Net  developer who's experienced in WCF to work alongside our various experienced development teams. The ideal candidate should be a self-starter with the ability to think strategically, to learn rapidly and to be unafraid of new challenges in technology.  Experience in the Media & Entertainment domain would be a plus. Company DescriptionThe digital world is rapidly evolving making it an exciting time to be involved in the space. At BusinessOnline we re-imagine the possibilities of online marketing’s future. We firmly believe in adding value to the digital world; that value comes from the spirited contribution of our people.Our Purpose:  Helping to build a more authentic, useful, and satisfying digital world.Our Mission:  Empower great people to deliver innovative, user-centered digital solutions that delight our customers by delivering meaningful results. Job DescriptionWe are a performance-driven digital agency specializing in B2B/B2C high consideration lead-to-sale challenges where analytics plays a very important role.  Our clients include DIRECTV for BUSINESS, HP, Workday and several hot Silicon Valley B2B startups.  Our culture is fast paced, fun, and results-driven.  We offer a casual and flexible work environment in Downtown San Diego.The Analytics and Reporting Engineer will engage in the full development life cycle of an in-house data warehouse and the integration of business intelligence tools to enable more effective strategic, tactical, and operational insights from sales and marketing data. This role is also responsible for technical implementations, troubleshooting, and configuration of analytics products (i.e. Google Analytics).This will involve working with stakeholders to identify requirements, proposing and implementing creative yet pragmatic solutions, hands-on development to integrate data sources, validating report accuracy and participating in the ongoing maintenance of the system. This role encompasses end-to-end services that will often require this individual to work across the full-stack of front-end, middleware, and backend systems. QualificationsAreas of Responsibility: Collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders to determine requirements, estimate level of effort, and implement solutions for data analysis, reporting, and integration projects across Web Analytics, CRM, and marketing automation systems.Design, develop, test, deploy and maintain integration solutions using Javascript, Python, MySQL, and TableauManage and improve our data warehouse and database systemsDevelop and implement ETL programs and tools to load data from disparate data setsDesign and develop visualizations using Tableau and Excel Implement, configure, and troubleshoot web analytics implementations (Google Analytics, Adobe SiteCatalyst,  Tag Management systems, etc)Skills and Experience Required:At least 5 years experience with database technology, including RDBMS, ETL, BI / Data warehousing, SQL programming. MySQL experience highly preferred.Strong fundamental programming skills with Javascript and a general-purpose language (we use Python, but experience with C#, Java, or other modern languages is OK) Experience with SAAS integration techniques such as REST APIs, Web Services, text and XML processingExperience with visualization and analysis tools, such as Tableau and ExcelSolid knowledge and understanding of Web Development, particularly implementing tracking and analytics tagging (experience w/ PHP is a plus)Experience with Google Analytics and / or Adobe SiteCatalyst is a huge plusExperience with CRM, Marketing Automation (Marketo, Eloqua) is a huge plusExperience with digital marketing and advertising is a huge plusExcellent collaboration and communication skillsAbility to multi-task and work across multiple projects with competing priorities and deadlines Our Strength is Our PeopleWhen you walk through our doors you can feel the surrounding energy and opportunity. We have an entrepreneurial spirit that fosters creativity and invites innovation. We work hard and play hard; building a collaborative and supportive culture. We believe in building relationships that lead to success for everyone.So what does it take to work at BusinessOnline?Passion, courage and ability! We believe that without taking risks and a drive to succeed, there is no growth. We applaud your ideas and challenge you to evolve and grow. We value commitment and your efforts are recognized. Put simply, it’s not just a job; it is a place where you can build a future. We invite ground-breakers, trendsetters and thought-leaders to work with us and usher in tomorrow’s cutting-edge innovations and ideas.Our CultureWe believe hard work should be rewarded and it permeates our culture. We are a family that works hard and plays hard. Our relationships and friendships are not confined to the office walls. From company-wide Rock Band tournaments, city-wide scavenger hunts, or beautiful sunset cruises along the illustrious San Diego coast; we’re always taking part in building personal relationships that grow the BusinessOnline Family.BenefitsWe value work-life balance and the overall well-being of our employees. You’ll see that reflected in our comprehensive benefits package — a combination of health care, retirement, profit sharing, paid time off, and other rewards.In the CommunityAt BusinessOnline, we believe in giving back to the community. We all love our city and respect it as being America’s finest. We recognize that it takes the collective will of the people to maintain this beautiful community. Volunteerism is embraced collectively and individually. Our team is dedicated to making a positive impact in the communities where we work and live. Through BusinessOnline’s community outreach program, we have supported many charitable organizations, including: The Surfrider Foundation, Working Wardrobes, The San Diego Food Bank, The Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, 10x10act and more.Professional DevelopmentWe understand that our people are the key to our success. We invest heavily in professional development — from paid college tuition, internal mentoring and educational programs, certification programs, professional organizations and association memberships. BusinessOnline offers a wide variety of resources to ensure continuous learning and growth.Equal Employment OpportunityBusinessOnLine provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons. The Company prohibits unlawful discrimination on the basis of a person’s race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, national origin, citizenship, veteran status, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, genetic characteristics or medical condition, or any other legally-protected category. Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for qualified individuals with disabilities.

job title: Business Technologies & Application Systems Analyst III
desc: Company DescriptionFounded in 2005, Georgia Gwinnett College (GGC) is the 31st member of the University System of Georgia. GGC is a premier 21st century four-year liberal arts institution accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges & Schools. With a current enrollment of almost 10,000 students, enrollment is projected to exceed 13,000 students within three years, including both residential and commuter students. Located in the greater Atlanta metropolitan area, GGC provides a student centered, technology-enriched learning environment. Gwinnett County (pop. 850,000+) is home to a variety of businesses, including organizations involved in health care, education and information technology.Job DescriptionThe Business Technologies and Application Systems Analyst III will provide technical and functional leadership in the analysis, resolution, and management of systems, applications and data.  The business and application analyst III will interface with both functional and technical staff on enterprise technologies, including student information systems (Banner), financials (PeopleSoft), human resources (ADP), and other campus technologies.  The analyst will work with functional staff in enrollment management, accounting, purchasing and academic affairs to complete all tasks related to business process engineering and automation of business processes, within and across units.Responsibilities include but are not limited to:Provide ongoing support and resolution for complex technology, application and/or data issues.Develop reporting systems to integrate data from enterprise student and financial systems, including large-scale data modeling and mining to support data-driven academic and business decision-making.Work with stakeholders to optimize work flows and business processes through process re-engineering, such as end-of-month close processing, semester start and end processing.Serve as member of cross-unit team to support student information systems integration and data use.Participate on project team to upgrade, or apply patches to systems, including feature evaluation and support for functional users.Liaison and provide support between the functional and technical areas for system development.Support business intelligence initiatives, quality assurance initiatives, and institutional research.Support administration's compliance to regulations, policies, and audit activities via reporting and accepted best practices.The position reports to the Associate VP for Educational Technology Development and Evaluation and works closely with the application development staff and various units across campus.QualificationsMinimumCollege diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, information systems, or computer engineering.Five to seven years job related experience, including experience with SQL queries, PL/SQL required. Prefer experience with AppWorx and/or Oracle Form.PreferredMaster's degree preferred in related field or business systems.Prefer experience in higher education with date-intensive applications, Banner, Blackboard, PeopleSoft, ADP.Additional InformationDue to the volume of applications, applicants may not receive a reply from the College unless an applicant is selected for an interview. Review of applications will continue until positions are filled. Hiring is contingent upon eligibility to work in the United States and proof of eligibility will be contemporaneously required upon acceptance of an employment offer. Any resulting employment offers are contingent upon successful completion of a background investigation, as determined by Georgia Gwinnett College in its sole discretion. Georgia Gwinnett College, a unit of the University System of Georgia, is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, national origin, age, disability or religion. Georgia is an open records state.

Company DescriptionDeviantART was created to entertain, inspire, and empower the artist in all of us and today is the leading destination on the Internet for creativity and the arts.  Job DescriptionWe’re looking for someone who can:Manage all data, business analysis and administrative services for the Chief Operating Officer and select members of the staff.Analyze, problem solve, and develop business processes.Work independently with clients and vendors, documenting business processes and workflows, analyzing how Business Intelligence solutions can be delivered to support those processes and workflows and synthesizing data for presentation to COO and other senior members of staffRepresent the office of COO at client meetings or networking opportunities, taking insightful, detailed and informative notes to bring back and present to COO.Maintain a positive working relationship with other employees at all levels of the organization.Create reports (analytics, statistics, etc.), collect and synthesize sensitive data, draft corporate communications and presentations (including charts/graphics) as required.Handle multiple projects/tasks simultaneously, establishing or revamping procedures where needed.Lead or train others in procedures that support the department and company’s initiatives.Establish and carry out departmental and organizational goals, policies and maintain confidentiality at all times when working with sensitive material andexhibit a high degree of professionalism.Ability to work under little or no supervisionAdditional InformationMust work from our HQ located in Hollywood, CA Have an established network and knowledge of Los Angeles' up and coming technology scene, as well as, knowledge of the online community/tech environment worldwideBenefits include medical, vision and life insurance with optional dental.  401k also offered.

The Data Science group at Wayfair solves some of the most analytically challenging problems facing a rapidly growing Internet leader with millions of customers and complex business operations.The mission of a Data Science analyst is to unlock deep learning from data in order to help guide the business – everything from tactical optimizations to broad level strategic direction that is grounded in data evidence and heavy analytical rigor. This requires a multidisciplinary blend of statistics, technology, and business strategy, all applied in tandem to discover key insights that lie hidden in our data sets.This role centers around learning how to improve our business by exploring and drawing insight from our trove of customer and clickstream data. This involves ad-hoc analysis, wrangling large amounts of data and translating quantitative findings into strategy recommendations.We work with cutting edge technology and multi-terabyte datasets, making this an exciting opportunity to develop or further a career in business and big data analytics. Responsibilities include:Serving as a consultative partner to internal clients (i.e. marketing and site development) to develop analyses that lead to actionable recommendations which accelerate profitable growthWrangling data from multiple sources including sales, product, customer, and clickstream databases to create integrated views that can be used to drive decision makingWorking with large, complex SQL databasesUnderstanding and applying data mining techniques to generate deep insight and discover effective solutions to challenging problemsDelivering presentations to high level business stakeholders that tell cohesive, logical stories using data Qualifications:BA/BS, with strong academic record, ideally in Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, or other quantitative field1-3 years experience in a quantitative business roleExperience with Excel, SQL and data analysis software such as: R, SAS, STATA, SPSS etc.Intense intellectual curiosity – strong desire to always be learningPositive, people-oriented, and energetic attitudeAnalytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving difficult problems About WayfairWayfair, founded in 2002, is the largest online-only retailer of home furnishings and house wares in the United States. The company owns and operates Wayfair, AllModern, and Joss & Main. Wayfair ended 2012 with over $600 million in revenue and currently employs over 1,200 employees in offices located in Boston (HQ), Utah (Customer Care & Distribution), Kentucky (Distribution), the U.K, Germany, Ireland and Australia.Wayfair was named Private Company of the Year by Mass Technology Leadership Council, and selected by Glassdoor.com as a Top Company To Work For and Top Company For Well Balanced Life, and #16 on Forbes list of America’s Most Promising Companies. It's a great time to join and help build the next great ecommerce company!Wayfair is located in the Back Bay section of Boston, MA.Visit our Site: http://wayfair.comRead our Engineering Blog: http://engineering.wayfair.comFind us on Facebook: http://facebook.com/wayfairFollow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/wayfairCheck out our YouTube Channel: http://youtube.com/therealwayfair

OPERATIONS DEVELOPER (UNICA ANALYST)Allant is a rapidly growing marketing & advertising services company that supports Fortune 500 advertising clients and media firms including TV & online video publishers and distributors. With a 28 year old history of success, and industry leading client satisfaction rating, Allant offers technology, analytic, marketing and advertising professionals a career opportunity at the forefront of database marketing, interactive marketing and the future of TV advertising.The Operations Developer (OD) will support Allant personnel, clients and end users in their day-to-day use of system tools.  Technical responsibility includes having an in-depth knowledge of campaign creation and modification via our software tools deployed by Allant. The OD will manage multiple concurrent projects, handle service related requests, field a variety of product related requests and insure product program compliance with client account goals. The OD will be required to understand and communicate technical concepts and will lead internal and external clients as needed in the execution of standard system activities, as well as being expected to engage in technical conversations with the client on a daily basis to troubleshoot campaign/software issues. PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESFocus is across Unica campaign execution, service and strategy.Support clients’ marketing campaigns across multiple channels including Direct Mail, Email, Outbound Telemarketing and other.Perform daily tasks including but not limited to Unica campaigns, data manipulations, reports, issues/investigation troubleshooting and scheduling of these tasks.Collaborate with account team and client to understand business requirements and specifications.Gain an understanding of the client’s business and provide technical strategy and insight into solving their business problems.Translate requirements to design, recommend and guide technical solutions for client based systems.Design, develop, test, maintain and modify Unica campaign programs to solve client and/or internal business needs.Ability to research and resolve moderately complex problems.Author and maintain campaign execution documentation.Provide estimates for campaign development efforts and formulates plans as part of pre-sales activities.Act as a change agent by identifying and implementing program/system changes for improved quality and higher efficiency.Work in a team environment and establish productive user relationships, both client facing and internal.  REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree required in Marketing, Business or Information Systems preferred or 1-2 years of relevant work experience.3 years of Unica experience required.2+ years of experience with Oracle/Netezza SQL preferred.Experience interacting with clients and investigating and resolving issues.Strong business process/operational and analytical background.Excellent organizational skills including strong written and oral communications, and the ability to work well in teams.Ability to effectively communicate and interact with all levels of management.Position located in Naperville, IL with minimal outside travel required. On-site daily presence is required.

We are currently looking to fill a Programmer Analyst (Solution Developer) role in our Naperville office.  Allant is a rapidly growing marketing & advertising services company that supports Fortune 1000 advertising clients and media firms including TV & online video publishers and distributors.  Allant offers technology, analytic, marketing and advertising professionals a career opportunity at the forefront of database marketing, interactive marketing and the future of TV advertising.DescriptionPrimary Duties and Responsibilities:Perform hands-on ETL and Oracle development to create Marketing and/or Business Intelligence database solutions.Collaborate with Technical Lead to understand solution design and processing specifications.Independently use Allant tools, ETL framework, and Oracle to develop solution per specifications.Design, document, and execute unit test cases.Author detailed process flow documentation.Collaborate with Quality Assurance to test and rework applicable solution components.Education, Training, and Experience:3+ years as an Oracle developerQL expert (2+ years of use in day-to-day job duties)NOTE: Oracle PL/SQL is not heavily used and is not a requirement.2+ years of hands-on heavy duty ETL experience.2+ years working on a Linux/Unix platform2+ years of Perl experience (or similar interpreted language like Python, PHP, Lisp, Ruby, etc.)Solid communication skillsSolid writing skillsSelf-motivated and self-managing.Enjoy working with small IT teams (5-10 IT professionals)Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related curriculumsUS Citizen (No H1B's)Working from home is not an option. Prefer applicants that live within a 45 minute commute.Must be interested in becoming a permanent employee.No travel required. Preferred, but not required:Database Marketing Industry experienceFamiliarity with Oracle analytic functionsExperience working with large (multi-Terabyte) databasesExperience optimizing SQL queries using explain plans and/or tkprofFamiliarity with Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Business Objects, Crystal Reports, OBIEE, Alterian, Cognos, etc.)Familiarity with Campaign segmentation and selection tools (e.g. Unica Affinium Campaign, Alterian, Aprimo,etc.)

The Allant Group is experiencing positive growth and looking to attract the best minds in omni-channel media analytics!Explore career opportunities with us where you can immediately apply your creative analytical thinking and strategic insight prowess to make a real difference in the rapidly evolving digital video and TV analytics arena as a Sr. Analyst-Advanced Advertising.DescriptionThe Allant Group is an established database marketing firm located in Naperville, IL that is expanding its advanced video advertising practice.  Allant’s TV/ internet solutions are tailored to the needs of top-tier distributors, network programmers (content providers) and leading national advertisers.  Our solutions brings together the audience selection precision of direct marketing, the performance accountability of digital marketing, and the emotional brand storytelling of video across consumer devices in a privacy-safe fashion.  We are currently looking to fill a Senior Analyst role on this Etsy is seeking data mining scientists to join our data science team. As a scientist at Etsy, you will be developing cutting edge algorithms that drive our recommender systems and search ranking engines. This development includes both research and engineering across our entire stack: data analysis and algorithmic prototyping, implementation within our Hadoop infrastructure, and integration with Etsy's web stack.  You love experimentation and are motivated to understand everything you build, from algorithmic changes to front-end improvements. You look forward to embracing our continuous deployment process at Etsy and believe in a highly iterative approach to problem solving.About the Engineering Team The technical staff at Etsy believes that code is craft, good software and systems designs are works of art, and that the work we do is part of larger creative culture represented by the hundreds of thousands of inspired makers who make Etsy such a wondrous marketplace. We believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. We also believe in the right tool for the job, not language-as-religion. Our current systems run PHP, Java, Scala, Python, Ruby, Solr/Lucene, Postgres, MySQL, and more. Check out our Engineering blog.About the Job:As part of the data mining team at Etsy, you would:Build next-generation recommender systems, search quality algorithms, and targeting / optimization applicationsPrototype and implement algorithms via Hadoop and over hundreds of terabytes of data with scala and javaExplore data, diving deep with python and R.Integrate algorithms with Etsy's web stack via PHP and javascriptDeploy continuously, test continuously, and learnAbout YouTo be a great fit for this role, you have:3+ years experience building industrial data mining systemsExperience with Hadoop and working with multi-terabyte systemsDeep understanding and experience with state of the art machine learning and data mining algorithmsExperience working on search ranking algorithms in an industrial settingM.S. or Ph.D. in Computer ScienceAbout UsEtsy is the marketplace we make together. We have 20 million members in over 200 countries. In 2012, our sellers grossed more than $850 million in sales. Our mission is to reimagine commerce to build a more fulfilling and lasting world. Our offices are like this and this. We're empowered and expected to be ourselves, share our ideas and figure out what we can each do to keep Etsy evolving. We have full company-paid benefits, including family and domestic partner benefits, humane working hours, couches, quiet spaces, lunch twice a week and handmade desks.We're growing rapidly and are well-funded with a proven business model and established revenue to help us continue serving our community.

Have you ever thought about what it takes to detect and prevent fraudulent purchases among hundreds of millions of eCommerce transactions in six countries? What would you do to create a trusted marketplace where millions of buyers and sellers can safely transact online? What kinds of processes and systems would you build to maximize customer satisfaction?Our mission in Transaction Risk Management Services ("TRMS") is to make Amazon.com the safest place to shop online. The TRMS team safeguards the order pipelines; monitoring, tracking, and managing risk to ensure long-term buyer satisfaction. TRMS group designs and builds the software systems, risk models and operational processes that minimize risk and maximize trust in Amazon.com. Not only do we protect all aspects of the Amazon shopping experience, we also deliver our services to large and small merchants hosted on the Amazon platform. The Director of Analytics and Insights will be a vital member of our small, cohesive Marketing team. You will be tasked with informing our key business decisions with insights from customer data, and will play a role across all marketing activities from customer acquisition to lifecycle marketing to customer profiling and insights.Specific Responsibilities include:Utilizing key website and transactional data to derive actionable customer insights that will empower our team to develop better marketing campaigns.Driving a test and learn mentality across all marketing efforts to help us optimize revenue, profitability, retention and loyalty.Measuring customer LTV and making recommendations on how we can extend it.Monitoring Google Analytics to shed light on how customers are engaging with our site; working with marketing and product colleagues to find acquisition and website optimization opportunities.Working closely with our Data Science team to develop, prioritize and execute a roadmap for reporting and analytics (including dashboards, customer segmentation and profiling, predictive modeling).Managing our market research and customer insights efforts (NPS, quarterly surveys, focus groups)What we want to see in you:You are data obsessed, great at translating numbers into business insights and uncovering both the what and the why.You are equally comfortable talking with developers as business leaders.You’ve spent 5-7 years doing analytical work in an ecommerce or financial services setting, preferably in support of marketing activity such as acquisition, engagement, conversion and retention efforts.You have masters in statistics, applied math or econometrics.You are proficient in advanced Excel, Google Analytics, SQL and statistical toolsYou are used to rolling up your sleeves and getting your hands dirty.You are self-sufficient in getting the web and transactional data that you need. If you don't already know how to get what you need, you WILL figure it out.You are excited about developing and executing an analytical roadmap that includes: Key Metric, scorecard and dashboard development; Customer Segmentation, profiling and insights; Predictive modeling of customer behavior.You understand the importance of using resources (outsourced and internal) to execute an analytics roadmapYou know how to design and manage complex test and control programs for email and websites.If this sounds like you and you want to be part of an energetic, innovative, fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where your ideas will be implemented and you’ll have a major impact on success, submit your resume to and include a cover letter explaining why you would be a great fit.Why BirchboxYou’ll work under complete transparency. Our founders don’t have big fancy corner offices – they sit right next to our employees and everyone knows where the company is headedYou’ll find an agile setting with very low barriers to getting things done.It’s a chance to be at the start of something huge: we’ve only made a small dent into what we plan to do and we continue to grow rapidly.  We are pursuing big dreams and we’ll give you the chance to explore yours tooYou can dive into our crazy supply of beauty products – test and enjoy them sometimes before they even hit the shelves (there’s plenty for men!)We’re all about having fun. We are an energetic, innovative team that laughs a lot.You get to own a piece of the company and work with the pride of ownership. About BirchboxBirchbox is a disruptive eCommerce company on a mission to change the way consumable lifestyle products are purchased online. We combine a subscription service that delivers high-end samples directly to members, paired with an online shop and original editorial content. Our platform revolutionizes the way customers discover products and delivers our brand partners a better way to access customers.Launched in the fall of 2010 we have quickly grown to be the definitive leader in the field of subscription retail. We are one of the fastest growing startups in New York and have the backing of top tier VC firms Accel Partners and First Round Capital. We’ve received praise in Marie Claire, Cosmopolitan, The Huffington Post, Fast Company and more. To keep up with this fast growth we are building a team of energized executers who want to be part of creating a truly new business model. We are results driven, creative and aim to delight our customers in every way possible.

job title: Data Scientist - Analytics and Software Engineering
desc: Birchbox is looking for data scientists and senior data scientists with software engineering skills to work on data-driven tasks, including:Monthly box personalization: tailoring the selection of samples sent to each Birchbox subscriberFull-size product recommendation: based on purchasing history, samples received, profile and browsing data, etc.Analytics for the marketing team and for our brand partnersImprovements to offline and online reporting of key metricsRequirements:Experience modeling data and designing feature setsDeep working experience applying statistics and machine learning techniques to real-world dataFluency in a programming or scripting language (e.g. Python, Ruby, R, Java ) for fast prototypingExperience building and working with "big-data" platforms (e.g. Hadoop/Mad-reduce), especially applied to web-analytics and/or time-seriesExcellent data-visualization skillsAbility to extract insights and communicate to a non-technical audiencePluses:Ability to write complex SQL queries in short orderExperience building advanced analytics dashboardsPrevious experience in e-commerce and/or start-up environmentsMS or PhD in a relevant disciplineWe are interested in hearing from motivated people who can be strong individual contributors to our data team.Tech @ BirchboxThe technology team at Birchbox is responsible for development (and maintenance) of the company's customer-facing sites (in the United States, France, the UK, and Spain), managing hosted and cloud infrastructure, and closely supporting other teams (logistics, marketing, et al.) in our 110+-person company. We work with a wide variety of open-source technologies: Debian-based servers; Chef deployments; Ruby on Rails, Java and PHP services; and Python, Perl and R scripts. The size of our team and the breadth of its responsibilities means we rely on our engineers to be self-motivated and quickly follow through on tasks without requiring close supervision. In return our engineers are given leeway to use their own initiative.Our team spans software engineering, technical operations, product, and data science. Our challenges include:evolving our software and systems architecture to support a rapidly growing customer base across multiple countries and languages;designing and implementing the best user experience for our customers; We are striving to revolutionize online retail.using data, complex algorithms, and statistics, to personalize the Birchbox experience for our customers, both offline and online.Why it's great to work at BirchboxThe uncommon chance to be at the start of something huge. We dream big. We run fast. We love a challenge.The chance to build a fresh infrastructure to express better solutions to old and new problems.The opportunity to work on conceiving, designing and building a next-generation ecommerce experience.We think Espresso, Cake, Cookies, Chocolate, and Cambodian Sandwiches are food groups. Which is part of the reason why we also believe in working out in the office. Push-ups anyone?We love our work, our team, and our customers.About BirchboxBirchbox is changing the way consumers discover and purchase grooming, beauty, and lifestyle products. We combine a monthly subscription service with original editorial content and a fully integrated e-commerce shop. Every month, members sample high-end products targeted to fit their personal profile and behavior, learn about them through our content, and purchase full-size versions of the products they like. Our platform provides our brand partners with an innovative and efficient way to access new customers.Birchbox launched in the Fall of 2010 and is one of the fastest growing companies in New York. We are backed by top VC firms, including Accel Partners and First Round Capital. In September 2012, Birchbox expanded internationally with the acquisition of the Paris based discovery service JolieBox, operating in France, the UK, and Spain. You can get a feel for the buzz about Birchbox, by searching for us on YouTube: http://birch.ly/nl6nVp. For traditional media coverage, checkout our press page: http://www.birchbox.com/press.Birchbox has offices in New York, Paris, London and Barcelona.

As a Twitter Data Scientist, you will be designing, building, and shipping complex models that learn from Twitter data. We are looking for folks that are passionate about understanding data, are well versed in scalable data mining and machine learning techniques, and love to build models. If challenges like the Netflix prize and KDD cup excite you, this is your dream job. A passion for measuring model quality and iteratively improving them using feature engineering is a big plus.ResponsibilitiesApply data-mining, machine learning and/or graph analysis techniques for a variety of modeling and relevance problems involving users, their relationships, their tweets and their interestsBuild complex statistical models that learn from and scale to petabytes of dataUse Map-Reduce frameworks such as Pig and Scalding, statistical software such as R, and scripting languages like Python and RubyWrite and interpret complex SQL queries for standard as well as ad hoc data mining purposesDefine metrics, understand A/B testing and statistical measurement of model qualityUnderstand and leverage crowdsourcing and human computation approaches to data labelingRequirementsMS or PhD in computer science, data mining, machine learning, statistics, math, engineering, operations Research, or other quantitative disciplineFluent in one or more object oriented languages like Java, Scala, C#, C++ Experience with scripting languages like Python or Ruby, etcExperience with feature engineering and model buildingExperience with statistical programming environments like R or MatlabExperience in mapping business needs to engineering systemsDesiredThree or more years of industry experienceExperience with large datasets and map-reduce architectures like Hadoop and open source data mining and machine learning projects Active Twitter user

About this Role:We are looking for an experienced Database Engineer or Systems Engineer that wants to work in a complex and dynamic database environment. We are looking to add to a team that is laying the groundwork for our service to scale in a cost-effective and reliable wayResponsibilitiesYou must be an experienced Database Administrator or Systems Engineer. You will work with other Senior and Junior DBAs, Site Reliability Engineers, and Product Engineers to investigate problems, implement solutions, achieve efficiency gains, and automate repetitive tasks. You will have a strong work ethic, the ability to keep complex tasks organized, and an amazing attention to detail. You must not have an itchy trigger-finger.Successful candidates will have:A strong analytical nature and at least mid-level database systems administration experienceA strong desire to learn how to administer large-scale Vertica clustersRequirements:Three or more years of hands-on experience in database / systems administrationExperience with Vertica, Oracle, MySQL or other database systemsKnowledge of SQLAbility to write Bash, Perl, Python, and/or Ruby scripts for monitoring, regular maintenance, and automation of tasksPluses:Knowledge of system tools such as netstat, lsof, iostat, vmstat, and others, and the ability to deploy that knowledge in production-critical investigationsFamiliarity with systems-automation tools such as puppet or chefAny level of JAVA, C or C++ programming experienceExperience with ETL and Data Warehouse systems

Use data, your mind, and methodology to solve fascinating problems. Compete is recruiting an outstanding individual to join its expanding Advanced Analytics team as a core member, our Director of Advanced Analytics.The Director of Advanced Analytics will join as a key member of the Compete team that is currently dedicated to the development and applications of the state-of-the-art methodologies and innovative research tools. The Director will be responsible for ensuring that analytic projects are implemented and utilized to drive client’s business objectives. This position requires strategic and tactical thinking with a delicate eye for numbers, an intellectual curiosity, a proficiency at problem solving, and an in-depth understanding of media ecosystem and technologies. The candidate must have a proven track record in data-rich analyses, media and marketing modeling, be a team player and extremely responsive in a client service environment.Compete is an entrepreneurial, fun, and rapidly growing company that provides business intelligence to Fortune 500 companies on how consumers use the Internet. To learn more about our culture, please follow us @CompeteCareers and visit our award-winning blog. Specific responsibilities include:Identification, assessment, and managing implementation of data sources, tracking solutions and technologies relevant to client’s businessDesign and management of measurement systems for data capture and reportingUse of analysis to identify the key touch points/factors that drive consumer decision-making behavior and make recommendations that will drive media strategy, creative and site optimizationUse of advanced quantitative analysis and other data mining techniques to create the core products and solutions as pertaining to multi-platform consumer behaviorsInform, drive implementation and utilize a multi-touchpoint path-to-purchase and attribution models Constantly engage knowledge of advertising and digital media to deliver client-specific analyses including: marketing and media mix modeling, campaign performance projections and analysis, customer segmentation and profiling, retention analysis, lifetime value analysis, and competitive market researchIdentify key measures, approach and methodologies to track digital marketing campaign success against clients’ business objectives – develop advertising test design including hypothesis development, cell design and sample size calculationBuild a body of knowledge on media, technology and strategy performance with the objective of informing future media decisions on schedules, budgets, partners and strategiesAct as primary day-to-day contact on measurement system project development and execution; facilitate communication and define roles and responsibilities amongst all parties including internal, client, and third partyQualifications include:Enthusiasm and curiosity about new and emerging media including digital display, SEM, broadband video, mobile, gaming consoles, Smart TV, etc.A Graduate Degree (MS or PhD) in Statistics, Math, Econ, or Marketing with prior demonstrated success in a quantitative fieldA deep understanding of the fundamentals of media planning, marketing and consumer behaviorFamiliarity with leading third party ad effectiveness providers such as Compete, Dynamic Logic, Insight Express, comScore, Nielsen Online, etc.Familiarity with audience measurement tools such as Compete, Comscore and NielsenKnowledge of survey research methods, sampling methods, weighting, and methods of correcting for sample biases.Experience with large data sets and background in database analytics (SQL and or related database languages).Background in univariate and multivariate data analysis techniques; expertise in either SAS, SPSS or R. Experience with OLAP and data mining techniques.Experience with advanced Excel, through to complex functions and VBA Experience with data presentation (BI) tools such as Tableau, Venngage, and Visual.ly An ability to effectively communicate complex ideas to a general business audience Experience in delivering presentations Excellent project management skills; experience with online project management tools a plus.

The Vice President of Data Management & Operations is charged with the overall responsibility for Compete’s data foundation, upon which ALL of our products and services are built. The Data Management & Operations team is responsible for everything ranging from data acquisition and integration, to core operational and product data methodologies, to functional oversight of day-to-day data processing and quality control, to product management of all data access tools, to supporting the internal customers of the resulting data asset.You will keep our BIG DATA trains running on time while simultaneously laying new tracks and building new engines (we hope you like this metaphor). To achieve this you will lead your teams to create new processes, systems, tools and capabilities in response to the needs of your market-facing customers (Product teams, Client Services teams, CRO) and to constantly optimize the manageability, flexibility, and utility of Compete’s data platform.To learn more about our culture, please follow us @CompeteCareers and visit our award-winning AdAge blog. Responsibilities include:Be an active and strategic voice on the Compete Management team, driving our core data vision forwardDesign, build and drive overall strategy, methodology, and roadmap for the processes, systems, tools and capabilities required to produce and maintain our core data assetsLeadership, management and growth of multiple data departments within the organizationDirect management of Sr Managers and mentorship to their respective teamsSynthesizing the needs of key market-facing stakeholders into clear roadmaps and execution plansHandling inevitable disruptions to and artifacts in data processingGrowing the data asset to support Compete’s aggressive growth plansConstantly keep up with industry data trends and drive high performing teamsQualifications include:A passion for solving complex system and data challenges and desire to thrive in a constantly innovating and changing environmentBachelors Degree, Masters a plusSignificant experience working with and leading robust software systems with a high data output10+ years of experience managing technology driven teams focused on robust technology systemsDynamic leadership and management experience of multi-disciplined teams with various prioritiesPast experience as a technical expert in engineering, data analytics, business analysis, BI, etc prior to leadership/managementA huge plus is exposure to a data intensive environment!

Facebook is seeking a machine learning engineer to join our engineering team in Menlo Park. The ideal candidate will have industry experience working on a range of classification and optimization problems, e.g. payment fraud, click-through rate prediction, click-fraud detection, search ranking, text/sentiment classification, collaborative filtering/recommendation, or spam detection. The position will involve taking these skills and applying them to some of the most exciting and massive social data and prediction problems that exist on the web.ResponsibilitiesDevelop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, data regression, and rules based modelsSuggest, collect and synthesize requirements and create effective feature roadmapCode deliverables in tandem with the engineering teamAdapt standard machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU)RequirementsB.S. Computer Science. M.S. or Ph.D. a plusA minimum of 5 or more years experience in one or more of the following areas: Fraud prevention engineering, machine learning, large-scale data mining for analytics.Proven ability to translate insights into business recommendationsExperience with Hadoop/Hbase/Pig or Mapreduce/Sawzall/Bigtable a plusExpert knowledge developing and debugging in C/C++ and Java on *nixExperience with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, PHP, and shell scriptsExperience with filesystems, server architectures, and distributed systems
